Aroma and taste is fruity and malty, some tangerine, peachy and grapefruit notes, piney herbal hoppy, toffeeish and caramel sweetness coming in, bitter hoppy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - oiled pine hops, citrus (lemony quality), floral hops and caramel malt.
Appearance - the body is a slightly hazed mahogany body. The head is around 1 1/2" and settles slowly. Some wispy lacing.
Taste - has a light caramel body with the whole gamut of hops. Citrus, floral, pungent, pine, and herbaceous hops. The citrus qualities have a touch of lemon and grapefruit.
Palate - medium body, slightly oily texture, average carbonation, bitter finish that is medium in length. Soaks the center of the tongue.
Can. Pours light yellow with some head. Nice milder hop nose that really hits home though when you drink it. Thick and chewy this is a solid IPA.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
16 oz can. Take this one with a grain of salt, because it was canned on 02/17/2015. The pour is a deep amber color with a thin cap of off white head that falls down pretty quick to a film leaving some solid lace. The aroma is incredibly malty. There is a sweet caramel thing happening. All of the hops are done and gone, that's for sure. The malt is strong. The flavor is again very malty. There is a little bitterness that I'm not too crazy about. It's definitely past its prime. The mouth feel is heavy, and the carbonation is a little softer. This one is an interesting glass of liquid. The aftertaste has a little bitterness with it, but for the most part it's just an absolute malt bomb that got lost in the year old debacle. Ugh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I read a lot about this beer as being tops of the charts. This IPA I think is overated for any form on top 50 charts. Yes, its good, but a little bland. No single thing sticks out.

pours a rich copper amber with a decent beige head. Aroma is pine and citrus. Great taste. initially bright then hoppy bitter kicks in. Beautiful balance between a good malt backbone and a hoppy citrus bitter. Hints of mandarin orange and grapefruit. Pleasant moderately bitter linger after the finish. Excellent beer!

COD 12/1/15. Pours a lovely amber with a strong garnet cast. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Quite outstanding nose of orange, orange rind, tropical notes (mango, pineapple), subtle pine and even more subtle spicy spruce. Underneath is a rich biscuit base that is bready with soft caramel hints.

Light medium body that is quite smooth and has creamy aspects. Normal carbonation levels with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a stronger finish.

The flavor profile is outstanding with a laid back bitterness and intensity, fairly complex and well balanced. Hops arrive in a blended fashion and never really separate, although orange is noticeable from the middle on. The middle has a moderate bitterness that is rind and pine based. A solid malt sweetness balances from the middle on, which allows the orange to shine. The finish is dry and a rind bitterness lingers. As the finish fades, a subtle spicy spruce note arrives.
Can. Pours dark golden with thick tan head. Aroma is pine, citrus and skunky. Taste is sweet and hoppy with a warm copper citrus hop finish. Pretty good but.

I pint can, many thanks to Rian (Thirstybird). Amber/ orange with an off white head. Resinous floral aroma. Flavour is a delicious multi US hop citrus cocktail, backed up by sweet juicy malts. Palate is oily and pleasantly bitter with smooth natural carbonation. Lovely.

Poured fro the tall boy can of a 4-pack, clear dark orange with lots of chunky foam. Taste is lip smacking, resin, tropical, sticky, spicy, & dry, this drinks heavier than a 6.2%. This is probably the tenth 4-pack Ive purchased of furious and every time I get too buzzed to rate it, that in itself is a vote of confidence.

Can shared at a tasting at Max place. Thanks Excellent Little Brother for the delivery! Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of old hops, skunk, fruity and a little old. Tastes hoppy, bitter and skunky. Light-to-medium body, green finish.

16 Fl. Oz. Can. Poured deep orange, clear, big off white head and lots of lacing. Aroma of citrus fruit and hops. Taste is also bitter, lots of citrus fruit but well balanced by malts making it quite smooth. This a great IPA, super enjoyable and certainly very enjoyable.

Can pour copper deep orange with moderate ecru head. Nose pine, resin, light dank, some grass. Nice hop nose. Taste moderate bitter bite up front then pine and dank. Mid palate balancing sweetness. Nose seems bigger than the flavor. Lingering pleasing bitter finish.

16 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 10/20/2015. Pours fairly hazy/cloudy reddish orange/copper color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, light roast, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, light roast, and floral/grassy earthiness. Large amount of pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; with a good malt/bitterness balance and minimal hop astringency after the finish. Good amount of dryness from bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, sticky/resinous, and slightly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome IPA. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. Despite the darker malt and appearance; this was still very dry with minimal overall sweetness as expected for a west coast style IPA. A highly enjoyable offering.

16 oz can. 6.6%. Canned on 09/22/15. Thanks a million Timo A!
Clear red amber color with a tiny off-white head.
Citrusy and piney hops, moderate bitterness, freshness, citrus and some dry malt in an amazing aroma. Yummy!
The flavor is... super yummy! Fresh hops, moderate bitterness, citrus, pine, oily fresh hop cones and dryness in the flavor. Very fresh! 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I dont think of myself as a hop head but I really enjoyed this, maybe because it is balanced with a good deal of maltiness. As noted elsewhere, pours copper colored with a good head that lasts well. Drinks smooth on the palate with strong spruce notes and a remarkably pleasant bitterness. Well done Surly.
Caoba turbio y espuma canela ligera. Aromas cítricos, pomelo y pino. Cuerpo medio, sabor inicial acaramelado, breve,  sabor intenso cítrico y resinoso con amargor intenso.
Clear copper with light brown lacing foam head. Good hoppy aroma and decent bitter taste. An IPA in all its form. Kight citrus tones and lasting aftertaste. (Arnhem 201511)

App: clear copper brown with an off white head. 
Nose: pretty restrained but nice vinous hops and caramel malt. Fruity.
Taste: solid malt base to carry the hop load. Evereting in good ballance.
MF: medium with good carb
Aftertaste: somewhat bitter but overall very nice and drinkable IPA.

Pours a slightly hazed deep crimson with a fair khaki head that settles to a ring and leaves some crashing waves and splotches of foamy lace. Nose involves deep grapefruit and dankness reminiscent of Amarillo, some evergreen and spruce, rich malt notes including caramel, biscuit, berries, and toast. Maybe even some bubblegum. Decently sweet, quite bitter. Medium bodied, fair action, lush with hop oil, finishing on the dry side with herbal leaves. A nice red IPA, drinkable, lots of qualities complementing one another, and very expressive.

W aromacie początkowo uderzają żywice, później lekkie nuty tropikalne, z naciskiem na ananasa, karmelowo - zbożowa podbudowa słodowa, intensywnie i świeżo. Podobnie w smaku, żywice, tropiki, mniej cytrusów, solidna słodowość, balans, długa, nieco zalegająca w popiołowy sposób goryczka, choć i tak nie psuje to ogólnego wrażenia. Bardzo dobra robota, acz piwo nie olśniewające. Thanks @vipinvelp
Clear amber color with foamy head. Strong aroma of hops. Like it a lot. Heavy bitter taste, long bitter finish. Heavy with everything, but its well balanced and easy to drink.

Can @ Rowdy Rebel Revel, Sønderborg. Pours hazy rich amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt & hops, with notes of citrus and fruit and some estery touches. Bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of needles and round, fruity and malty touches. Linhering, bitter aftertaste. Good.
Hazy amber, big white froth. Piney aroma with caramel. Juicy, fruity hop flavour, well combined with caramel. Slightly rough in a nice way. Lasting bitter finish. Really nice.

Draught @ Green Mill: This one pours a fairly clear coppery/amber color. There was a small off white head that leaves some lacing. The nose is good. A good mix of pine and tropical fruit hops. Some malts and grain in the background. The taste is very good. A good hop flavor. It is a mix of pine and tropical fruits. A nice balance between all of them. Good malts and grains in the background. This is a keeper.

50cl can from mikkeller webshop. Color is copper to red. Head is persistent and thin and beige. Bitterness is high, sweetness is low. Aroma is piney, hops, citrus, orange. Flavour is pepper, resin, hops, malt. So so good.
Can at home. Pours hazy Amber with a white head. Aroma of malts, pineapple, quite juicy, bready, a bit of faded hops, soapy. Taste is quite sweet, caramel, piney, grape. Carbonation is soft.

Bottle - Thanks Martin! Pours hazy dark amber with an off white head. Aroma is floral, citrus, bit of crystal malts, bread, a bit stale. Taste is all of the same. Would love to try this a bit fresher.

Can shared. Amber-copper pour with creamy off white head. Aroma is really hoppy, quite dank, light oniony notes, pine, grapefruit, biscuity malt notes, light caramel. Taste is quite bitter and malty, rich caramelized malt notes with piney hop bitterneess. Palate is med bodied, creamy with light-med carbonation. Definitely an old school IPA, but I can definitely get this was probably the best there was 5 years ago.

A 16 fl oz can canned on 8th July 2015 and poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. It poured a clear copper amber colour with slightly less than two finger white head that leaves spotty lacing. Aromas are tropical fruit especially mango, peach and apricot, some caramel malt, biscuit and hints of grass and pine. Less fruit than I expected in the taste, mainly malt, biscuit, caramel and lasting piney bitterness. Maybe a hint of citrus grapefruit, and its peel, but not much. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall a very nice IPA. It was a lot less fruity than I expected after taking a whiff of the aromas, but the malty and piney hop bitterness was balanced and very good.

Aroma of pine resin, hops and citrus, pours a dark copper color with a short lasting white well laced head. The taste is pure bitterness, the bitterness overwhelms any other flavors other than pine resin and hops. Oily medium body with a bitter hop finish.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2016 Can to glass. Pours clouded red, creamy off-white head, good lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, sweet caramel malts, toffee and roasted grain. Taste of same with bitter cocoa nibs, deep grains and citrus pine bitter finish. Mod syrup mouthfeel with lots of tiny effervescent carb. Flavor lasts and lasts. And lasts.

Aroma of pine needles, mango and grassy bitterness. Taste is bitter fruityness with quite a lot of grapefruits and lemon peels with some mango. It never completely crosses the line of too bitter. Great balance.

Beermiscuous, Chicago can: poured in a pretentious IPA glass in which it looked light amber with a pretty, lacing-leaving ipa head. Aroma is pine, earthiness, toffee malts. With some light fruitiness. Taste is fairly bitter. Lingerig bitter aftertaste. Not too much sweetness. Tasty, but I do not think that this was life-changing.

Can from MKLR webshop. Drank from a glass, as instructed by can. Pours a clear amber colour with a somewhat large beige head which slowly recedes to a foamy beige layer. Aroma is dominated by bitter hop attributes - pine, earth, grass and hop oil with some faint whiff of orange in there. Taste grass, spruce, pine needles, medium-high bitterness, orange zest, hop resin, hop oiliness (what Id imagine hop oil tastes, though I have never tried it), a slight malt sweetness is prevalent throughout but it mostly hides in the background and runs away quickly as the hops catch a glance, like a ninja. Full bodied with a rich mouthfeel.
Hops and malt and hops. All are top-notch and the combination is a heavenly balance of bitter and deep -- floral and nutty and earthy.
From Dan. Nice bronze color, mildly cloudy, nice yellowish foam. Aroma of orange toffee. Malt, burned sugar with clear alcohol in the aftertaste and a strong growing bitterness. .

Ipas have become a gray area ranging from boring to good. In the grand scheme of things there really isnt such a thing as a "bad" ipa. Hops are good. Brewers know that. Add more Hops and bam 90 rated ipa. This one, however, has gone above and beyond to be slightly more interesting and is therefore a standout in a sea of much less interesting beers. The complexity of the Hops coupled with the very strange interesting maltiness make it a very interesting beer.

This is a beer. A beer so good that it embodies the essence of an IPA. If I were to describe an IPA to someone who has never had one it would be this. But this is an absurdly good version of an IPA. I wish I could drink it more but they dont sell it in my state.

Can enjoyed @ home. Pours clear amber with a thick off-white head. Aroma is oranges, sweet malt, floral, lemon and pine. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, sticky texture, average carbonation. Finish is malty and resinous.

Really enjoyed this one. Has a unique flavor I can't quite put my finger on. Very solid.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2015 Sample at Great Taste of the Midwest.  Aroma is pine, sweet tropical fruit. Appearance is amber, off white head. Taste is pine, some sweet fruit and nice hops. Mouthfeel is lighter than Id like, but suspiciously easy to drink. Overall, its pretty good.
Can shared by Damian and Lona. Pours a hazy amber with a layer of beige head. Aroma and taste of malts, nice hop addition. Basic formula but done to near perfection.

Pours a hazy orange-amber color, with a decent head.

Smells of juicy oranges among biscuity malts, topped off by a note of crisp lime. Malts are very prominent on the nose, evoking a sweeter appearance of the beer, balancing the fruity hops easily. 

Has a medium carbonation, as well as a medium body, while producing enough hop bite to remain pleasantly refreshing.

Tastes of bready, slightly earthen malts, with white orange zest mingling into the beers malt backbone. Oranges grow stronger on the palate, due to the mineralic carbonation and lime juice, introducing a challenging hop bitterness to the tongue. The beers balance remains enjoyable throughout though, as the malts provide enough power to withstand the dry turning, slightly grassy hop onslaught, while staying on the bready side. Its sweetness gets provided by utmost juicy orange and blood orange, teaming up beautifully with lime juice. Finishes with a sweeter, fruity impression, completely focussed on the tropical hops, which create a long lasting dryness. 

Fantastic, intensely hopped beer, which remains easy drinkable. Very fruity and refreshing, while the malts not only settle the balance but also add to the flavors in a very efficient way.

Poured honey, amber with great lacing. Nose has notes of citrus, hops with strong pleasing floral notes. This beer was citrus upfront, with a delicious hop middle, and finishing clean with a lingering hop aftertaste. The palate was crisp, clean and smooth. If this beer were an animal it would be a rabbit...hop...hop...hop

A can in a Minnesota airport on way home from CA. Pours reddish amber with small head and sticky lacing. Aroma is toasted malt, grapefruit and pine. On the malty side. Taste is orange syrup, pine needles, cola, caramel, rye and an astringent, mouth-drying finish of pine and grapefruit peel. Very enjoyable!

Draft. Red-brown color; tan head with substantial lacing. Pine and grapefruit aroma. Strong malt backbone with resiny pine and grapefruit in the backend. Dry hoppy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can dated 3-3-15 so it was about 3 months old :( Pours a surprisingly dark copper. I was expecting lighter color. Great tropical fruit aroma, wow! Moutfeel was slightly towards the heavier side, but just for an ipa. Taste was fantastic. More tropical fruit and citrus with some slight bitterness. Fantastic beer. Wish I could get it around me. and this stuff wasnt even that fresh.

16 ounce can dated 06/09/15, which makes this about 6 weeks old. Aroma has some spicy hops, which almost make it rye-like. Some floral character is also there, with sweet caramel maltiness later on. Pretty aromatic. Transparent orange-amber body with a small, tan head present. Starts with a little hop spicy kick, before this becomes quite malty in the middle with caramel notes. Finishes with an earthy, herbal bitter hoppiness. Very well-balanced beer.
Well done. Amber color, creamy head with lace. Sweet pine aroma. Interesting mix with the whiskey malts and a very complex hop body on the tongue.
Favorite IPA. Nice hops, nice finish. Best on tap but nice poured from the can also

Can. Dark orange amber with a nice off white soapy head. Aroma is sweet resiny hops and caramel sweetness. Chewy malts and sticky hops are very nice, but I dont know if it is the world class beer the ratings indicate. Certainly good.

Furious even pours angry; deep copper red with a heavy 1" ivory head. Aroma is deliciously complex potpourri of spruce, mango, grapefruit, toffee and heady malts. Taste is incredibly smooth, all sweet toffee and citrus fruits up front, fading to the great hoppy bitterness. This one is *good*.
Furiously delicious. High IBUs but nicely balanced with malt. Americas best "Midwest-coast IPA"?!

This is one of the best beers on the world regardless of style. That said, the brewery and the cans now list the ABV as 6.6% NOT 6.2%

Part of what made this beer so wickedly awesome is that a pint came in at under 200 CALS and at 6.2% but tasted WAY bigger than most 2IPAs. This apparently is not true. There are not many beers that I would select over Furious even at 6.6% but it is a bummer that the whole 6.2% was a myth.

On tap at Tipsy Cow. Amber colored with piney and floral hop aroma and taste. Definitely a hop bomb but the malt sweetness does help balance it. Pine, grapefruit, and slight toasted malt flavors through out. Finishes bitter with medium carbonation
A very good beer full of flavors and and hops galore, my new all time favorite

Pours a dark amber with a thick bubbly head from a tall boy can. Fits well in an imperial pint. Aroma is distinctly hoppy with only slight roasting flavor. Flavor is some roasty roast. Roasted roasted hops, roasted roastedly on a roaster. Who would ruin a beer like this?

Had on tap at Ikes, in the Minneapolis/St. Paul airport. The only drawback to this beer was that the poor was into glasses that were wet and killed the head almost right off the bat. The apricot liquid only had a thin layer of off-white head, but the first sip was infused with such a large aroma it knocked me off my seat. Sweetly bitter in the first cough, and a fairly short palate finish for something is bitter as it was. A lightweight medium body, and great combination really buoyed the experience. This was a fantastic beer.

Pours a hazy bronze with a white head and lacing. It has a great aroma of spicy, piney hops and malt, and the flavor is set and spicy hops up front with a great malt backbone and great, bitter finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a luminescent red with a thick, foamy off white head that stays permanently. Nose is bready. Taste is very well balanced with rich malt vying with a bouquet of hop notes for dominance. Slightly astringent finish with sharp bitter aftertaste. Delightful!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canned 4/6. Pours a mostly clear amber light copper color with a light tan head. Aroma is fresh, wet hops, piney, caramel malts. Flavor is loads of wet piney hops, but not overly bitter. Thick piney hops lingers in the flavor. Tasty. Thanks Drew!

50cl can recieved as extra in a trade. poured a clear orange colour with a white head. notes of floral hops, crisp malts, pine hops, caramel sweetness, citrus,, notes of tropical fruits, pineapple, orange, not of fruity as i was expecting, long and strong hop bitterness, clear malt profile, very full flavoured beer for the 6abv. nice!

From a can into a sifter. Red copper slightly cloudy body with large tan head and lots of lacing. Nose is caramel, pine, grapefruit, peaches. Medium to light body, medium to high lively carbonation, moderately sweet, low bitterness, dry finish. Shorter finish a tad watery, but makes it a very drinkable IPA. Overall a nice piney hop profile with enough fruit and floral nots to make it interesting, not too bitter, great session beer.

Can at home. Pours a dark copper color with medium retention and a small bit of lace. Aroma is pine citrus, caramel malts, a bit of tropical fruit. Nice hop notes. Taste is solidly bitter. Tropical fruit, citrus. A bit of cracker and caramel. Great bitterness. Medium body, highly carbonated. A bit of an oily, almost resiny finish on the palate. Awesome.
Bright hop nose and taste. Nice deep color. Chewy body with a substantial malt body and alcohol to suppor the massive hopping. Bitter in a good way. Yum
Dark Lord words words words words words its still raining words words not as cold with words words
Can thanks to Brian,poured into a tulip..amber hue with a fluffy white head..big hop aroma with caramel notes..crisp,piney,resinous..good lingering bitterness..good stuff.

16 oz can to pint (canned on 03/10/15). Looks solid; malty though. A fairly transparent deep orange with off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes hops and caramel with a sticky medium-bodied mouthfeel. Could be lighter and dryer, but enjoyable nonetheless.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is Clear orange with a big white head and sticky lacing. Big grapefruit, candied oranges, some grass notes, light cat piss and weed notes in the aroma. Taste is weed, orange peel, grass, some grapefruit, bread, and herbal hops with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Tasty, Im just not a huge simcoe fan.
Great floral smell. Mediocre brownish appearance. Smooth, balanced taste. Good.
Strong beer with good malt backbone. It is heavy in the hops. Almost to much bitter hops for my taste.
Piney, citrusy and bitter. Terrific lacing, great ruby color, and the taste stays on your lips for hours afterward.

Golden orange, cloudy with an ample tan head. Apricot or pineapple, honey, lightly floral, some pine resin. Quite bitter backed by nice amount of biscuity malt sweetness. Medium body, fairly oily, quite acidic, lively, longer acrid finish. Excellent.
Tan light copper hued. Ivory foam. Orange rind, caramel threads, tangy and bitter, sweet caramels.

I love the Abrasive one from Surly, and I, like others, am excited to see an interesting new brewer in the region. However, I was a little disappointed in this offering, as it is fairly thin tasting and one-dimensional. Not a bad beer at all, of course, but I was expecting something more than another average IPA.

Deep orange pour with a quarter inch beige head. Nice aromatic hops, pine and florals, pollen too. Average carbonation, thick frothy mouthfeel, effervescent crisp finish, numbing to tongue. Taste is bites pine hips and citrus zest with smooth even balance provided by Carmel malt.

Lovely clean Amber with a tan head. Aroma is intense pine, candied tropical fruits, mild toasted malt. Medium thin bodied. Flavor starts relatively sweet, pine, citrus fruit. Finishes with lingering medium bitterness. Pretty solid. I wish the flavor lived up to the aroma.
Big fall leaves on a crisp day aromas. Cloudy orange tinted brown with ring and isles of head. Smooth earthy hop hits, ballances, then rinsed. Very refreshing yet still great flavors.

Pint glass on tap. St Louis Park, MN. 

Pours copper/amber in color. Moderately hazy. Small white head. 

Aroma is heavily hopped. Citrus and pine notes dominate. Caramely, malty under notes as well. 

Taste is mildly bitter, sweetness as well. Nicely balanced. 

Medium-full body for the style. Solid malty mouth feel. Generally enjoyed this beer.

Look: pours a dark orange. White fluffy head. Very clear.
Smell: hops. Grapefruit. Mango. Orange.
Taste: grapefruit. Mango. Oranges. 
Feel: dry. Medium carbonation.
Overall: good beer. Like the hood and malt combo. Very smooth.
First drank: home 3/15/15
Vintage: 2/17/15

Slightly hazy auburn pour with a two finger, creamy beige head that has great retention and leaves decent lacing. Aroma is dark caramel, lots of toast, light nutty notes, light crusty bread, citrus, pine and some sweet stone fruit. Flavor is very toasty and somewhat nutty up front, some nice cereal, dark caramel, crusty bread, a toasty, almost smoky wood note, deep, bitter citrus, woody pine, and hints of bitter stone fruit. Medium body, juicy, chewy entry, medium, blanketing and sharp carbonation and still juicy, but drier, finish with a nice hoppy bite. Really great beer, all the right notes for a punch you in the face with citrus and pine kinda IPA, but with a surprisingly deep malt base and just the right feel accompany it.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 Lovely color, red, red amber. Microyeast bits. Hoppy aroma not real intense, fruit floral spice combo maybe. probably will rerate because Im getting over a cold. I bugged out when I seen this in the store in IA today,as Ive been waiting a long ass time to try any surly. I cringed though when I seen hyvee stack them in the produce aisle as a display instead of a fridge where they belong. Not complaining I got one from the fridge cooler and thankfull they are distributed. Has a sharpness in taste- maybe a roasted/toasted caramel, citrus, with a almost grahmy like crackery malt, then hops, lots of pine, loads of bitter. good dryness in finish. Quite piney and bitter with a solid distinct malt flavor/character.

Citrus and spicy smell. Strong malt backbone that is refined. Hop bittering is strong but balanced well by the bready, plumy malt. Finish is evolving from bitterness and light fruit to dried fruit. Taste flows nicely

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quenches my hoppy palate with a very drinkability smooth carbonation that makes me wanna pound them down like Miller Lite when I was 18. Not as exciting as its big brother Abrasive which plays Varsity where Id say this is a solid JV player...Cheers!

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 From pint can at MSP airport. Again on tap.  Clear red pour with white head and a good amount of lacing on the glass. Citrus aroma. Grapefruit flavor with grapefruit bitterness, but also toast and caramel. Bitter and dry. Medium weight slick mouthfeel. Dry finish.

Aroma: Grapefruit, citrus, and pine

Appearance: deep amber with minimal white head

Taste: light initial bitterness, finishes with a medium bitterness and light sweetness. Bitterness lingers

Mouthfeel: light bodied, slightly sticky

Overall good beer. Great hop aroma and bitterness to balance out the maltiness.
Great IPA. Full body and really hoppy. Has a nice hint of grapefruit. Very smooth. Almost velvety.
Flight at MSP. Different for an IPA, some savory spice. Creamy, slick body, nice lacing. Medium golden, some honey, not a lot of hops. Mid west IPA?
16 oz can pours Amber with a off white head. Aroma of citrus, floral and sweet malts. Taste is caramel and citrus with a hint of resin.

(On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends, Jan 11 2015) Pours clearing dark coppery Amber with pillowy off white head, lingers with lace. Aroma nice and fruity IPA style, grapefruit to the fore with tropical fruit - pineapple, papaya, melon? - nice and malty with rich bready caramel. On the palate it was surprisingly malt driven, again caramel and lightly bready with cereal grains. There is a round reserved fruitiness that had grapefruit and orange peel and flesh, creamy tropical fruit , but muted quite quickly. Pretty big resinous bitterness but light flavours from middle on, mostly just dry! Slight pine sap. Average mouthfeel and carb. A bit disappointed with this one given the hype. Bitterness and maltiness for sure. Flavours dont really seem to match the best IPAs Ive had. Still I will happily give it another shot.

Clear amber golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, resin, citrus, fruity hops, light floral. Quite bitter hoppy flavour, resin, grapefruit, pine. Hoppy finish, grapefruit, resin, pine.(from draught @ CBC blue session, Copenhagen 2014)
On tap. Hazy and amber with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of pine, floral, pineapple, and mango. Taste is of pineapple, tangerine, pine, light floral herbs.
This is like Sculpin out West, very popular beer and a good easy drinking IPA. citrus notes and hoppy. It pours darker then most IPAs. Nice strong bitter finish

Can dated 11/18, poured into tulip. Pours reddish amber with small head and tons of sticky lacing. Aroma is toasted grains, root beer, grapefruit peel, roasted orange, bubble gum, pine, cola. On the malty side. Taste is orange syrup, pine needles, cola, caramel, rye bread, and an astringent, mouth-drying finish of pine and grapefruit peel. Full mouthfeel is a highlight. Pretty good.

This is a huge IPA. Powerful hop profile with the perfect malt to match. Beautiful beer, reddish amber with a chunky head that dissipates. The hops and sweetness round out with the malt. I could certainly drink too much of this one.

16 oz can from Andys Liquors in Rochester, Minnesota, served in a stem glass. Pours clear orange-amber with a moderate tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has huge notes of resin, tropical fruit, pine and grapefruit, along with medium toasted malts and hints of toffee and bread. The flavour is Intensely bitter throughout, with a huge resinous happiness that builds towards a long, bitter finish. Notes of citrus peel, tropical fruit and lightly toasted malts come through nicely as well. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice IPA with an intensely bitter hop profile. Though the aroma is impressive, the brewers have clearly emphasized the early-addition hops on this one. 2014-12-17

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.
Copper, quite clear body, with a medium, creamy, white head.
Aroma of citrus, peach, dark berries, pine, some tropical fruits, tea.
Taste follows this pretty much, with some more caramel malts.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a strong carbonation.
Finishes bitter, dry, zesty, piney.

Really tasty! One of those darker IPAs, with interesting dark fruit and tea like notes. Greatly balanced and really quaffable. Not my favourite IPA, but a fantastic one for sure!

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a clear amber body with a small off-white head. Nose is red fruits, red berries, grass, peaches and hints of pears, nuts and caramel. Lovely. Taste is grass, hay, herbs, red fruits, pears and hints of resin and grapefruit. Medium body and carbonation. Refreshing and nice IPA.
On tap at Stone. Clear Amber pour with an off white head. Grapefruit hop aromas. Tasty grapefruit Hoo notes dominate. A sturdy caramel malt backbone gives balance. Good body and mouthfeel.

@ Mikkeller Stockholm 14-11-8: ganska maltig, liten humleton. Känns gammal. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!
Poured from 16oz. can. Pours a deep hazy copper color with a nice thin head. Aroma is Hops and more hops. A nice malt taste, but the Hops come through. Strong finish. A great IPA.

Tap in Chicago. Clean copper-amber with tan head. Lacing all the way down. Super fresh aroma of warm orange and caramel malts. Pine and grass shine, especially on warning. Medium body. American hops squarely in the driver seat. Big, harsh flavors. Bitter throughout. And yet, despite the intensity, drinkable. Pleasant depth of flavor: malts are bready and citrus discuss open on warming. Toys the line of being a bitter bomb, but never loses the plot. Great beer.

Nice deep amber with a respectable light cream head. Pleasant citrus and pine aroma. Good malt base without being too sweet, but bitterness overwhelms. Hops are thick and last beyond the finish. Gotta be in a hop mood for this one.
16oz can pours a pale brown color with a bit of head. Medium hop bitterness that lingers after. The hops are really easy going, with no sharp flavors.
Fat på mikkeller and friends - bärnstens färgad och klar. Skummet försvann snabbt . Mycket malt i aromen. Smygande beska inte så mycket mer smak än det.
En bra IPA, inte mer. Lite dov i aromen. Bra beska som hänger kar rätt länge.
Amber with off white head - Fruity hop aroma - Good malt to support a good hop profile with a nice bitterness - Hops goes into the finish with bitterness - This was good
Great balanced beer with good hops and beautiful color. My favorite Surly beer.
can. Amber with one finger head. Medium malt base with big crisp hops. Very well balanced with excellent flavor. One of the best IPAs Ive had recently.

Dear lord, this is the best beer I have ever tasted. Hoppy, but balanced. Drinkable by dangerous. The best tasting brew I have ever had. As a testimonial, I moved back to Minnesota so I could drink this beer on demand. Its honestly the benchmark for all IPAs. If an IPA is better than this, then Zi would pretty much steal or kill to get it.

Can from Westlakes Liquor. Pours a dark murky orange with minimal white head. Nose is quite dank. Maybe some citrus and light tropical fruit in there to. Taste shows caramel, malt, toffee. Where's the hops!? Pretty uninspiring. Was expecting more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Lucky 13 in Bloomington. Not nearly as good as advertised. Doesnt have the bite or pine flavor in really good IPA.

Pour slightly hazy almond-brown, with a small white head. 
Aroma has plenty of pine, slight grass, light caramel, slight citrus, lemongrass.
Taste is slightly sweet up front, but is dominantly bitter,
Medium/slightly watery body, with a semi-fizzy carb.

"wow - this was so aromatic and huge in the flavor, i assumed it to be an imperial! Huge pine notes on the nose. smooth bodied (the body was the only thing about the beer that wasnt huge) and the flavor is hops, hops, hops. A bit of malt too, but pine dominates, and in a good way. quite tasty."
Tap, amber pour, white head, nose is hoppy, taste is super citrus, hoppy, bitter, lovely ipa.
Never had a surly, but thats going to change. Excellent beer, great malt and hop balance.

Cant believe I havent rated this by now. 

Lucky for me I can get this whenever I want. Very much my go to beer. 

Top notch
Curtesy of Wayne Lancaster. Big hop aroma with note of grapefruit; the flavor is also hop and is slightly sweet.  It is a well balanced and enjoyable brew.
16oz can - light pine and tropical fruit aroma . Medium bitterness , with some lingering fruit . Very approachable .

Cloudy amber orange with no visible carbonation and a thick, slightly orange head. Hint of citrus aroma. Tangy flavor; charred hops, bitterness. Light body, smooth palate, lingering drying finish. A little flat for my taste.
Bottle @ Joes. Clear amber to copper colour with a small off-white head. Smells hops, gasoline, fresh, nice little. Tastes bitter, hops, fresh, grassy, pine, fruity. Medium body, nice crisp carbo.

Can @ home thanks to Mista. Clear dark orange to reddish color, medium to full sized off-white head. Aroma is malts, hops, fruit hops, grapefruit. Taste malts, hops, fruit hops, grapefruit, bitter, pine, resinous bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice!

Can about 5 weeks old. Pours darker gold with a nice soft head and decent lace. Aroma is rich dank, spicy, and cedar hops on earthy moist grain. Flavor is bitter, spicy, soapy, and even a bit of something that reminds me of smoke but isnt, the sweetness is lost almost but is there. Feel is lively but potent, almost medicinal. This is an odd one. Its not what I like in an IPA but its got a lot of character.
50cl can, American brew, thx alot to Thomas for bringing this over!, complex bitter brew, bitter/malty/fruity and slightly woody/sweet, very balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew

Draft at the brewery. This is a big, ruddy red beer. The aroma and flavors are big as well ... chewy, caramel malt, piled on with a solid, hoppy twist. Not sure its a "100", but its damn good. (#5652, 8/28/2014)

Sample at Haand Festival 2014. Medium brown body with a white head. Piny aroma with toffee and fruity hops, taste is light sweet, caramel malt and fruity hops. Intense bitterness, dry hoppy finish. Nice one.

On tap @ Toronado Seattle. Pours bright orangish brown with thin lacy white head. Aroma is big caramel malt with light floral citrusy hops. Taste is roasty sweet caramel malt with balanced earthy citrusy hops. Quite malty for an IPA, but well balanced with plenty of hops to balance. Much less hop driven than a west coast IPA, but big and flavorful nonetheless. Super stoked to finally try a Surly beer.
Orange-brown pour. Nose is onion, pineapple. Taste is onion, citrus, resin, pineapple. Dry bitter finish.
Aroma is floral hops, pine and a hint of candy/sugar. The flavor is citrus, relatively light grapefruit, malts, mild hop resin and a long and very bitter/dry finish.

16 oz can, served from same on Fox Lake, IL. Aroma is hop bitterness with grapefruit and tropical fruit - pineapple and mango. Flavor is same with perfectly balanced tang of juice in the finish. Delicious, and a favorite.

Pours clear dark amber with a lace head. Light citrus hop aroma. Amazing citrus and pine hop pairing leafs into solid pine taste. Malt profile fits hops very well, woody caramel. Lower intensity malt and pine aftertaste. Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very well composed beer, and an IPA with depth of character to match the hops.
Draft. Bronze/copper with medium off white head. Aroma of citrus and caramel. Medium body with medium/high hop bitterness, malt backbone, and a nice bitter hop finish.

Poured from a can bought in Chicago. Pours a brilliant reddish gold with a one finger, white head that dissipates slowly. Aroma is of American hops right up front. Notes of pine and grass dominate while strong citrus aromas are also present. Pineapple and orange zest come through. Very mild malt sweetness comes through as well. Flavor is strong bitterness up front with a touch of malt sweetness. Very grassy and piney and the bitterness sticks with me through the aftertaste. Hints of caramel and toast are subtle. Malt is bready and grainy. Bitterness is subdued significantly as it warms. Mouthfeel is clean and light to medium-bodied. Overall, this is a fantastic beer. A very hop-forward, clean, and fresh IPA. If youre looking for a more malty, sweet IPA, this aint it.

My first time drinking Surly. Furious is smooth, not tropical or citrus-like but more of a dank, earthy IPA I suppose. Really well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from my summer secret santa. Pours clear dark golden/brownish with a big creamy beige head. Strong tropical fruity aroma, flowers and pine cones. Taste is light sweet malty, with a quite suitable bitterness, resiny and pine, smooth and weak creamy mouthfeel,lingering resiny, shure a good one.

Pours a dark gold, cloudy with a little reddish tint. Nice big head. Citrusy aroma. Lots of lacing left on glass. Flovor starts off with a quick hit of citrus than straight into bitterness. As I let it warm up Im getting a lot more citrus flavor and less bitterness. This beer proves to me that there are really good canned beers.

Ive been drinking this for a few years now since I moved to MN and it is always a solid beer to have around. Piney, hoppy, malty, and bitter on the back end. Dont look to this for a lot of citrus because you wont find much (there is some orange/grapefruit in there, but it gets beat up by the bitterness), but a great example of a solid ipa nonetheless.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 Can from Douberd, many thanks Christos. Amber golden color with thick white head. Nice strong citrus hoppy aroma. Solid malty base followed by nice hoppy kick with grapefruit, oranges, pines. Good.

Can. Clear amber color with big white head. Flowery aroma if hops. Medium body, oily texture. Grapefruit zest in flavor. Bitterness dominates. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma is floral hoppy, grapefruit, hoppy, hints of honey, caramel. Taste is medium bitter, lightly sweet, very hoppy, grapefruit, orange peel, hints of honey. Nice bitter finish.

Draft at Old Town Pour House in Oak Brook, IL The IPA poured a clear amber with a small off white head. The aroma was full of resin and some citrus. The flavors are aggressive and assault you. Bitter resin and citrus provide much to enjoy with each sip. This is a full bodied ale with average carbonation. Despite the high IBUs, this beers bitterness is remarkably gentle, ushering in a smooth finish without overpowering the tongue.

Bright, bold orange in color, this had a thin, spotty head that reminds me of new mexico storm clouds (the kind that look like someone spilled a bag of cotton balls). The nose is just as bold, citrusy, sweet, and divine. Theres some greenness to this beer, and the mouthfeel allows for a beautiful absorption of the tasty character. Citrusy, with a delectable cleanness and sweetness offered by Golden Promise malt, this is a full-flavored, refreshing, easy, clean, and spritey IPA thats hard to put down.

Can. Light amber body with white head. Aroma fruity herbal just wonderful. Taste is malts herbs fruits and pines. Aftertaste is medium bitter with fruits. I cant believe that this is 99 Ibus really great one. I wish I could drink this fresh every week.

Received in a trade from BVery -- Can poured into a pint glass. Pour resulted in sticky lasting foam that laces the glass very nicely. Aroma is a little disappointing, Mild Citrus and pine nose. Flavor is similar bitter hops initially and a strong malt backbone flavor hops are a little lacking. Mouthfeel is great. Overall I was expecting more from such a highly rated/regarded IPA. By no means is this a bad IPA, it is a very good IPA.
Tap at sheffields...With boogie n sara... caramel color with hoppy aroma and taste. Fucking awesome

Can thanks to the Cruise Director (aka markduccomun). Pours a light reddish amber with a light off white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, caramel. Bready caramel malt flavor, with biting "furious" citrusy pine hop cutting in midway to the finish. Smooth palate, real hoppy amber meets IPA.. strong malt backbone.

Can from Mikkeller online shop; clear copper pour with a frothy off white head, aroma is big pine hop and caramel, taste has mellow pine, with light caramel sweetness, some punchy citrus action, floral, moderate bitterness.
47 cl can @ home. Pours clear brownish amber with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, grapefruit, and pine - with a slightly bitter finish.

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured once in a pint glass and once in a tulip. There wasnt any difference.
The appearance was always a nice golden orange to amber color with a one and a half fingered white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. The lacing slid into the beer.
The smell had a nice sweet maltiness running underneath of a nice citrusy/piney hoppiness.
The taste was basically the same that lead to a decent sweet aftertaste and a dry sweet finish.
On the palate, this one sat at/about a light to medium in body and holds a decent sessionable aspect about it. The carbonation was slightly smooth as it didnt really seem to hold its own as far as sharpness for a normal AIPA.
Overall, good AIPA for the most part, but this seems to be just a tad too smooth as I didnt get the normal pummeling on my tongue from an AIPA. If anything, this is still worthy and maybe I hope to try this fresher some day.

Great hoppy goodness. One of best in- can brews, but suffers a bit on the head as a consequence. Best option available at MSP or Target Center when in the Twin Cities. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft poured into pint glass. The name says it all here - this is a hop heavy, deep amber IPA that amps up the IBUs whilst maintaining a malt backbone that keeps something of a balance here. But lets be honest - balance is not what you are looking for here. Some sweetness on the back end that does its best to level out the bitterness.

Can dated 5/13/14 poured into a Duvel tulip.


Appearance-Pours a hazy copper orange. A inch thick off white head shrinks to coat the top, leaving moderate lacing.


Aroma- Aroma is of sticky tropical fruit. It reminds me of a melon salad with waves of caramel sweetness that cut through.


Taste-Piney hops hit up front. The beer turns a bit jucier, with tropical fruit flavors. There is a lingering bitterness from the hop hit and there are some caramel flavors as well. Mostly bitter hops though.


Palate-The beer is fairly balanced, albeit hop forward. As expected, the finish is very dry.


Overall-Despite the local hype, I consider this to be a good beer, but nothing special. It has great flavors, but lacks a finer balance which detracts from the experience.

Location: Draft at Jake Melnicks, 5/27/2014


Aroma: The nose is full of hops, mostly floral and citrus, pine, spice, and some malty notes

Appearance: The pour is golden-amber in color with an off-white colored head

Flavor: The flavor is big and hoppy, much like the nose, with a fairly bitter finish to it

Palate: The body is medium, it has a decent mouthfeel, and a fairly dry finish

Overall Impression: 
This beer gets its excellent reputation for a reason. This one is really good. I mean I cant name too much not to like here.

Burk på Mikkeller, Sthlm. Bärnstensfärgad öl med smutsvitt skum. En IPA där karamellig maltsötman spelar en stor roll både i smaken och i doften. Denna balanserar en mängd humlearomer i form av grape, andra citrusfrukter, tropiska frukter och tallbarr.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2014
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, grape, orange and peach. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long fruity and bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

475 ml can at home, poured into a shaker. Canned on 10/1/14, ABV 6.2%
Dark orange colour on the body, clear, good activity in it, with a small mostly white head on top, a bit thin but with good retention on my shaker, a glass I tend to avoid for exactly this reason, the not so good head forming and retention.
Aroma has a malty backbone and lots of hops, tropical fruits, peach and nectarines flesh, light grapefruit, pine.
Taste follows, more piney now, more grapefruit, orange peels, quite bitter with long duration.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation, a bit oily on the palate.
Great beer, almost worth what I paid for it.

this is my definitive balanced IPA, it comes out with a nice grapfruit/piney nose/taste, and has a nice balance of hops and malt resulting in a solid clean finish. overall a great beer to try if you are in the minnesota area

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2014 I tried this when Surly first started becoming the "rage" to see what all the fuss was about. Way too hoppy for my taste, but beyond that, I dislike this beer. Far too much citrus. More like Omars Hard Limeade than a beer. You can tell Im not a fan of the over-hopped citrus style.

Great tropical hop aroma and deep amber color. The taste is more tropical hops with mango and raspberries shining through. The malt is there to back it up but doesn't get in the way of the hop profile. Really good.
Draft. Pours clear copper with thin head and nice lacing. Nose and taste is nice pine and grapefruit. Dry aftertaste.
25cl sample on tap. Bronze colour with a minimal head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Notes of pine. Flavour is moderately bitter. Some hops. Notes of pine and sour bread. A lingering aftertaste.

16 fl oz (475 ml) can at home, canned on 01/10/2014 (4.5 months old). Unclean amber-copper color with nice light frothy off-white head that lasts thin until the end. Very nice aroma, hoppy and malty at the same time. Light floral, pine, tropical and citrus fruits like grapefruit and orange, and sweet caramel malty scent too. Taste is the same. Some malty sweetness and a lot of hoppy bitterness! Very nice! Medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. One of my favorite IPAs!

Pours like pure liquid amber. Surprisingly deep amber actually. Wonderful dense hop flavours and taste. Tickles the nose this one. A carnival of candy, flowers, fruits and the like in the mouth, followed by a terrific clawing burning on the way down the throat. Leaves a sweet citrus effervescence on the "burp" as Oz Clarke would say.

Sample at Haand 2014
Dark copper, quite clear, white head. Smell of herbs, citrus, hints of basil, light malts. Moderate sweet, quite clean, citrus and spices. Medium bitter, quite well hopped. Nice

Gylden brun klar med beige skum. Humle, sitrus og grapefruktlukt. Bitter smak med sitrussødme. Bitter søt, lang ettersmak.
Haandfestivalen 2014

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Got a bit surprised of how copper it is, but it pours copper, almost like a scotch ale. Aroma is straight up citrus, a lot of tropical fruit, but also some nuttyness to it. The taste is super balanced, the 99 IBU in a 6.2% is not even really dominant, the malt body is different but somehow almost perfect to this 6.2% beer, I am usually against speciality malts in my IPA/Pale Ales, but this one did it way better than any other Ive seen.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 Haandfestivalen 2014. Mørk gylden med medium høyde på skummet. Aromaen er furu, malt, tropiske frukter og humle. Samme i smaken. Søtlig først, så fin og bitter i ettersmaken. Medium konsistens.

On tap at Haand 14. Copper colored , good foam. Immediate hops, some grapefruit, caramel, toffee. Full body & high complexity. Some sweetness, bitterness balances well. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can. Pours a hazy caramel with a one finger, off white head that leaves mild lacing. Aroma has notes of pine, resin, orange citrus, and faint bready/caramel. Taste is a solid bitter but with a solid taste. Pine, resin, slight floral, grapefruit, caramel, and bread, with a drawn out aftertaste and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation. Overall very nice. A strong bitter with pine, resin, citrus, and caramel.
Pours amber with some head and lacing. Aroma of hops and pine with citrus caramel. Taste had pine, grapefruit, orange, and lemon. Very tasty IPA.
Good perfumey head with light citrus. Pours dark mahogany with good head and lacing. Soft carbonation. Finishes with light sweetness, comes together well. Tap takeover at Churchkey,
Can, pours amber with a tan head, noticeable floral hop aroma, good hop taste that is balanced nicely with caramel and malt, this is a really good IPA

Can. Pours a nice dark amber. This is a great example of a beer that lives up to its hype. Refreshing pine aroma. Excellent balance of flavor with a hoppy start and finish with a little bread. Doesnt have the overwhelming bitter finish. Drinks really easy, while full of the flavor and everything I could ever want in an IPA. I would have no problem drinking this all day.
Darn good IPA. Good aroma, good hop flavor, but not bitter. Beautiful color. I liked the malt taste that comes out WITH the hop flavors

Tap @ CBC. Pours clear amber with a beige head. Aroma of nice hop forward notes. Lots of pine, a bit of floral notes, some clean citrus, exotic fruits and just a tiny bit of sweet malts. Taste is just HOP forward with notes of pine, oranges, lemon, grapefruit, resin and very weak sweet malts. Works for me!

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Amber with a small head. On the sweet side with grapefruit, hops, malt and some biscuits. Not that bitter. A balanced and easy to drink beer.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 16 oz can poured into a shaker. Very sweet, potent floral notes, along with ample citrus, cereal and a bit of bread greet the nose. A slightly hazy copper red colored body is topped by a puffy, doughy, light tan / orange head. The retention is okay, with a thick ring and a heavy wispy layer leaving behind a light, messy lacing. The tongue is met with a high level bitter thats cut nicely by a smooth, velvety, medium high sweetness. The texture is velvety smooth and slick, with a light, fluffy carbonation The medium body is bready with bitter citrus and the finish has a citrus and creamy caramel character to it with some sour cherries, and bubblegum, and a burnt hint and some pine. The aftertaste is not as overwhelming as I would have thought - given the bitterness. It cleans up nicely and consists mostly of a toast and peanut butter with some caramel syrup. The aftertaste does linger, but is mostly mellow.

This pours a semi-clear, dark amber color with a foamy, beige head. The aroma is strong with hops and citrus mixed with some floral tones. The taste is extremely bold in bitter hops especially for being 99 IBUs. Great texture with decent drink-ability but with 16 ounces, you can expect your taste buds to be ruined for a little while. The first Surly beer I have ever had and its delicious.

Pours beautiful Dark, clear amber. Aroma is really floral, fruity, exotic. Taste is really fruity, and the not very bitter. Really Nice fruits, that are Rather ripe and sweet. Delicious stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Phenomenal beer, perfect combo of hops and malt, dark rich brown color. Cant wait to have more.

Smooth malt quality on the palette with great 
Sweet hops too on the forefront. Smells great what is that undertone? Banana bread? 
Jeez I wish a had a growler of this! Frothy head dissipates quickly.
Definitely want to reunite with this again, Thanks brewyunker 4 the trade!

Sample from CAN at Nacht van de Grote Dorst, kindly shared by two Americans. THX!
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, nice stable off white head.
NOSE: hoppy, florar, fruity.
TASTE: hoppy, florar, balanced.

A - 5/5 copper amber, white head dies down to a thick film of bubbes w nice lacing

S - 9/10 - even served cold u can smell it a mile away, grapefruit, pine, pineapple, citrus zest

T - 9/10 - grapefruit, citrus zest, pine, pineapple, hops all around

P - 5/5 - medium - hops in your face , alc covered, bitter aftertaste all its own

O - 19/20 - def up there with Pliny in my book.

Can pour. Deep reddish orange with off white head. Aromas of citrus grass and whiskey. Drinks with a huge sweet malt that kicks the mouth with a burst of bitter pineapple and melon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh, this is one of the best IPAs Ive had. Citrus and a little pine on the nose, with the same on the palate. On the finish, there is a noticeable floral note, but good. Overall, a well done example of the style.
My first time drinking Surly. Furious is smooth, not tropical or citrus-like but more of a dank, earthy IPA I suppose. Really well balanced.

On tap at Jerrys, Chicago. Appearance is golden peach. Aroma is hops. Taste is the same with hops and some sweet resin; nice balance here. Definitely lacks a big fruity quality but what it does have it does well. Overall, good IPA.
Tap. Copper pour with a thin head. Pine, sweat, grapefruit,, leather. Hoppy and sweet bitter finish. Medium body with a nice spicy carbonation that makes this easy to drink. Nice

Dark golden semi cloudy body. One inch creamy head. Very hoppy wonderful aroma. Holy bitterness. Ive had beers more than 100 IBUs, but this seems so much more bitter. Very tasty. Great lemony flavors. Finally found a Surly beer and really enjoy it. Cant wait to try my Abrasive soon.

Bottle share @ Surly Darkness Day 2013. Pour is clear copper with a finger-wide white head. Aroma and flavor of pine needles, sweet caramel, tropical fruit, and light citrus. Finish is a bit malty for an IPA, with a bitter aftertaste.

Bière ambrée aux reflets rougeâtres, coiffée dune belle mousse crème. Le nez offre un impressionnant équilibre entre les malts et les houblons. En bouche, lamertume est tranchante, mais elle est adoucie par les notes caramélisées (voire même mielleuse) du malt. Un effet métallique / médicamenté sinstalle en arrière-goût après quelques gorgées... mais il suffit dune autre lampée pour briser leffet. Bon produit.
Can. A hop and pine nose. Not much of a head. Raspberry with copper color. Bitter grapefruit.
Can. Pours a cloudy orange with medium frothy off white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is pine, floral, and herbs. Medium mouthfeel with dry hop, pine, and bitter finish. Good.

Pours a honey/light copper color. BIIG fluffy head that lasted a couple minutes. Medium lacing. aroma is decent fruity hops with a bit of sweet malt.
 Nice hop bitterness with some Juicy fruit gum in the mix. Somewhat overpriced for what you get.Decent but not near as good as Oskar Blues Deviant Dales.
Pours cooper with white head and some lacing. Aroma of citrus hops and some sweet caramel. Taste is the same with tons of bitterness and toastiness. Very nice brew.

Can (canned 1/16/14) poured into a tulip. Pours a dark amber/ruby brown with two and a half fingers of off-white head. Decent lacing. Aromas of toasty notes, wheat bread, biscuit, citrus. Tasting notes of toasty notes, biscuit/bread, sweet malt, citrus, light pine. Medium body with a mostly dry finish. Nice IPA with some amber/red ale like qualities.

Can via trade. A moderate to high hop nose that is kind of muddled with citrus but also some heavy grassy notes, almost English-like in nature. Seems like they are fighting each other and not working together. A strong malt presence that is needed to stand up to the bitterness. But this seems more like a sweet DIPA than an IPA. a little too over the top in hops and bitterness. Would much prefer a less bitter, and drier IPA

IPAにしては味が  
特に苦味は少&

slight beige head disappears quickly with some lacing. amber colour. aroma of passion fruit, pine, citrus, slight sulphur. taste like aroma, wallnutpeel with quite bitter aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. nice!
Great and shocking IPA. Nice hops and bitterness, darker color than I am used to, great local brew to Minneapolis.

I love this beer. The color is a rich deep amber. Almost a golden brown or copper. That nose is very fragrant. Massive amounts of hop with hints of citrus. I detect sort of a copper smell as well. The taste is bold and balanced. Upfront the hops take hold and release your mouth to a very pleasant pine resin and citrus bite. It gives you a bit of its malty structure and finishes with a bitter kiss.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 Surly can make a good beer...there is no doubt...furious is one of surlys bests....great ipa....tons of flavor....huge head...on tap with bender at my work...both are great....love me some surly!
So glad chicago has Surly! This has become one of my go to hoppy beers. I also love having it in can format to fit at the top of my beer fridge.

16 oz. can, thanks to treebute. Dark hazy orange pour, with a small, beige head. Big aroma of piney hops, bitter grapefruit, coriander, and whole grains. Big bitterness, with a grainy sweetness, and just a touch of fruity sweetness. Slightly unpleasant, sour aftertaste. Heavy body, very grainy, sticky, and syrupy. This is a good, very hoppy IPA.

Can 16 fl oz thanks to Sgt. B (Brian), not on ratebeer. Sampled on January 25, 2014.Cloudy copper color, yellow to teal head. Sweet, hoppy, caramel scent. Malty, grainy, bitter taste. Grapefruit pith, bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.

This is truly a beer hard not to like. The malts on this IPA I feel actually are more pronounced then the hops unusual for an IPA. Slight taste of citrus very mellow. Although the can says hints of carmel if there not really tasting them. Great brew to par with a lot of different foods.
Can. Damn near perfect IPA, balancing bitterness, citrus, hay and boozy tastes. Best beer I ever had out of a can.

I love Surly, everything they do is special. They are one of the breweries that makes us proud in the Midwest. This is one of my favorite beers of theirs! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A beautiful copper color, darker than most IPAs. However I expected more flavor to accompany. Being my first taste of surly, I would say I'm slightly let down. Then again, IPAs have never been my most favorite style. So I won't judge too quickly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber hued clear brew topped by creamy tan head. Extremely aromatic w/ floral, toffee, pine & citrus notes. Caramel & toffee malt flavors balance out a very hoppy body. Maltier than most IPA's but damn good.

Thnx to Belgbeergeek 
Pours darker, fuzzy amber . Big soft white foam , very resistant . 
Smell is hoppy , but not too intence . 
Very soft carbo 
Taste is hoppy, green , bit bitter , but mostly aromatic . Bit fruity as well , pine-style ( a bit )
Can, thanks Chase! Nice citrus and floral aroma with a malty backbone. Wow, nice fresh orange and passion fruit juice flavor with a slightly bitter, but smooth finish.

Dark orangish brown, very carbonated. Smells citrusy alittle malty. Taste is bitter, very fruity orange like. Nice balance of hops and malt. Good beer! I'm gonna crush this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can, thanks to Scott L. Canned 11/07/03, enjoyed last night with my dinner. Caramel malt up front, good big grapefruit hop, light pine, lightly spicy hops. Good big bitterness. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Medium to bigger body. More dry finish. Mostly clear red orange color, more red than your typical IPA. Some fine particles suspended in the body. Bigger khaki head, with good retention, leaves plenty of good lace. Some tropical fruit in the aroma. Great IPA, especially considering the lower ABV, and especially especially considering how old it is. Drinking great right now; probably mind-blowing fresh. Was fantastic to wash down my Skyline Chili 3-way with, and the perfect portion for the job, too.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 This came from a can? Wow. I get citrus, grapefruit, pine and toffee. Beautiful fire Amber color with a laced white foamy hat. Medium body. Evenly palatable and extremely drinkable. Thanks bmillsy. Scottish malt and American hops, damn. I have to find more.

Deep orange pour with dissipating white head. Aroma is strong citrus and pine. Flavor is robust hops and pine, strong bitterness. Finish is overly bitter with overpowering alcohol presence. I consider myself a hophead, but (possibly due to an 1800 roadtrip from MN to AL) this IPA just seems unbalanced. Focus seemed to be to jam it with hops and damn the balance or anything else. Maybe I had a bad can?

Pour from can at MSP airport. Pours amber, unfiltered with off white, good head. Very citrusy and piney. A great IPA 99ibus 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. As far as standard IPAs go, this is definitely one of the best. Huge aroma and flavour. Complex. Satisfying.

Pours a dark ruby/amber with a thick and creamy, mocha head. A lot of lacing present. The nose is all hops. A lot of piney, resinous notes come in strong at first, but they break way for a slight citrus touch. A little bit of sweet malts and caramel are present as well. The mouth is very similar. A ton of piney hops and bitterness. The sweet malts and caramel play a role here as well. Smooth finish that leaves a nice, lingering bitterness.

Living in SoCal, this is tough to come by, luckily, I have family in MN who brought me 8 cans and I really enjoyed this one. More of a west coast style than what you might expect from the Great White North but it's done exceptionally well. Pours a dark amber with a nice, .5" head into a tulip. Well worth the try!

--- Save the unicorns!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Hopheads rejoice! Furious is the beer youve been dreaming of. The dark orange body holds the key to Hop Heaven. This IPA has tons of grapefruit aroma and layers of refreshing bitterness. Thanks to its generous malt base, Surly is free to turn the Hop level up to 11. Furious brings the tastes of the West Coast to the Twin Cities. The result is mind-blowingly good.

16 oz can, clear mahogany hue with off white creamy lasting head, carmel malt, some citrus and fragrant pine hop, powerful mouthfeel with medium to heavy texture, pretty complex, more English than American, drinkable but heavy

Enjoyed courtesy of BK... Slightly past it's prime in freshness, color was reddish orange... Aroma of caramel malts, light citrus hops... Flavor is malt forward, caramel and toffee with notes of citrus hops on the palate... Dries out a bit on the finish but overall pretty malty and sweet... Tropical notes, solid ipa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the Local Option, Chicago. Clear copper with 1" foam. Tropical fruit aroma - wow. Taste has good malt backbone with terrific American hops, and a bitter finish. Big smooth body. Fantastic!
Can. Aroma is a mix of hops and malt. Taste is a little cat pissy, bit of pine, slight sweetness. Decent IPA, but not my favorite.

Refrigerated 16 oz.aluminum can (canned on November 12, 2013, from BVery poured into a snifter. Pours medium amber with small off-white head which dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is nice floral hops, medium body, low carbonation, and thin small bubble lacing. Taste is floral hops, pine resin, and bitter finish.

Can. Pours clear amber with a medium sized, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus and piney notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and solid bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. An excellent IPA.

Rich amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of rich pine hops, resin, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, rich pine hops, some caramel, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is bitter; Nicely balanced considering all the hops; Good stuff.
Can. Pours hazy copper. Aroma is grapefruit, grassy, floral, hops, caramel and some citrus. Taste is moderate to heavy bitter and light sweet. Medium body with average carbonation.

Deep copper to golden pour with a thin off white head ... .aroma is of citrusy grapefruit and tropical fruits, light piney and resiny hops ..... taste is of caramel and toffee with a bitter citrusy/grapefruit, piney and resiny flavors and a huge bitter hop .... finish is dry with a lovely lingering bitter spicy hop bite .... malts def meld well on this one and are kind of there on the back end before the huge bitter onslaught ... could drink this all day
Can courtesy of HawkerB. Pours a hazey toffee color. Very floral aroma with grapefruit notes. Taste is more of the same but with added resinous tastes. Mouthfeel is thin.

Pint on tap at Bad Apple in Chicago. It's exciting to see Surly back in town. Amber appearance, moderate amount of foam and lacing. Hoppy, grass and pine aroma. Taste is all of the above with a solid caramel and malt backbone to balance things out. It's also not as bitter as I had thought it would be, given the 99 ibu's.  Medium bodied and smooth, mild carbonation.  Overall it's a fine ipa and definitely worth a try, but it isn't as much of a jaw dropper as I had hoped.

Purchased at West Lakeview Liquors in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home during a frustrating Saturday night. Im the opposite of frustrated though that Surly is now available in Chicago, which rules! This is a top of the line IPA. Appearance is a dark but slightly clear gold with a thin white head that lightly laces to the glass. Aroma is a huge mixture of citrus and grassy hops, definite tropical fruit notes. Taste is big in hops but surprisingly crisp and smooth to drink, a very enjoyable IPA which is quite rare. Looking forward to having this readily available within the market!
Nice IPA. Great aroma and nice finish. Bitter but bright on the tongue. Recommended for bitter beer lovers.

16 oz can. Pours a deep orangey color, decent off-white head with tremendous retention (Ive never seen a beer hold its top like this other than Guinness), solid lacing. Nose is tropical fruit and dankness (kinda reminds me of the time when I was 12 years old, on a cold morning at the rink 5:00 am one Sunday morning, when I discovered the cat had pissed in my hockey bag). Mouth is dry and fruity (mango, guava, passion fruit), lots of bitterness, but smooth at the same time (if that makes sense) nice long finish, and even at 6% this still feels sessionable. Having Surly in Chicago is a beautiful thing.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 A very hoppy and fruity ipa. Super fruity and really bitter beer. Goes Dow. Smooth and pits a light yellow in color. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
