Clear amber color, small steady beige head, lace. Fruity hoppy, even a bit cat pissy aroma. Medium-bodied. Fruity, grapefruity hoppyness. Fresh, nice lingering bitterness.

On tap at Urge. Pours a amber copper with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pin, peach, tropical fruits, sweet malts, and some bready malts. Taste is similar to the aroma with some nice passion fruit, tropical malts, caramel, and sweet malts. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, medium long finish. Overall, a tasty and well balanced IPA from a state not know for good craft beer.

A: Brownish/Reddish Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Piney, Citrus, Grainy Malts, Mild Caramel

T: Piney, Grapefruit, Grainy Malts

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter, Mildly Drying

Overall, a solid bitter IPA with a nice flavor meld of hops and malts.

Can, just arrived on my doorstep - thanks Jeff! Pours clear amber; offwhite head; streaky lacing, good retention. Aroma: pine, caramel, biscuit, grass, cat. Taste: moderate caramel sweetness, grassy/piney hop presence, assertive and lingering bitter finish that is surprisingly not harsh. Medium body, creamy slick texture. Overall: solid ipa with a well-deserved reputation. Not totally sure what makes this "furious," (I guess the entire ipa market has become increasingly aggressive?) -- I find it downright pleasant. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

can share at Craft Clerkenwell. Thanks to Ryan. Amber, copper colour with a nice off white head. Aroma is pine, resin, caramel biscuit malt, some berry. Flavour is caramel, pine , wet grass, Assertive mellow bitterness. Malt bill has a light toast, nutty caramel. Lowish moderate carb. Dryish finish.

Can from trade. Dates 9-24-13 poured 11-5-13. Should be fresh enough. Pours a deep dark copper red color with a half finger creamy, off white head. Aroma of toffee, biscuits, pine, citrus. Was expecting more hop profile here. Up front big time bitter, grass, pine, big time bready, toffee malts. Dry on the palate, clean finish. Medium carbonation, slightly slick, but mostly dry. This comes off more as an APA than an IPA to me given the big malt presence. Good brew nonetheless.

Pours a hazy dark copper with a medium off-white head that eventually dissipates to a thin skim. Great lacing. Smells of tropical fruit, resin, pine, and caramel malt. Tastes so great. Bitter, resiny, dank, grapefruit...delicious! One of the best IPAs out there.
On tap in Minneapolis. Malt accented nose with some hops noticeable. Pretty clear amber color with white head and good lacing. Piney hop flavors with roasted malt balance. Medium body.
Good, solid IPA. Not super complex. Not overly fragrant. Some citric notes. Nice color.
Can from airport in Minneapolis. A nice amber color. Complex malty-herbal aromas. Flavor is stellar. Well balanced with just enough sweetness to cover the intense hop bouquet. Excellent!

26-OCT-2013, can @home, from Mikkeller & Friends.
Slight gusher. Fantastic creamy head on amber body. Long lasting tan head. 
Already on opening I sense the hops. Powerful grape fruit and pine aroma with also loads of sweet malt. Taste the same. Caramel loads of fruit. Really fruity. Touch of licorice.
Hops are very dry with a sweet malty backbone. A very malty IPA. I like that. High density and soft carbonation makes it very drinkable..

Can shared at CBC Clerkenwell, London during the Jimmy G. Tasting. Thanks to Ryan for this can. Pours amber-gold with a creamy, off-white head. Nose of lightly dried pine and pithy grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor with dry, toasty bread malts, grapefruit, more pine. Medium bodied with average, lightly creamy carbonation. Moderately resinous to finish with dry bread and further pine and grapefruit. Solid.

Can thanks to Ryan. It pours clear amber with a thick beige head. The nose is toast, resinous, pine, pissy hops, grapefruit and lime. The taste is pine, earth, toast, resin, grapefruit, pithy tangerine oily hop, grass and light pepper with a juicy, bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crisp, fresh and utterly drinkable. Nice.
Pours a clear orange with a large light tan head. Aroma of caramel malt and huge citrus hops. Flavor is quite bitter, malty with citrus hops at the start and lots of pine in the finish. Very good.

Dark Hazy Orange/Red color with a foamy head, good lacing and mild carbonation. Very caramel malt forward in both smell and taste with some equally strong citrus and piney hops and and just a slight hint of toffee. Aftertaste is a bitter citrus/resin flavor. Body is heavy and the carbonation is mild. Very good IPA!

Sample at GABF - On a day where I purposely did not seek out many IPAs, this was on the bucket list. Was not dissappointed. Big citrus nose. Taste was super fresh blaskt of tropical and citrus notes with just enough malt backing to hold up. Easily could slam this all day. Lovely.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2015 Sampled at GABF 2013. A smooth and balanced fresh IPA. Nice malt backbone for the intense hops. Light malt sweetness and strong hop bitterness.  Update:  On tap recently, a good IPA, more likely a 3.7 or 3.8 for me nowadays.

Pours a ruby tinged brown with a wonderfully foamy off-white head that lasts seemingly forever. Distinct hop aroma forward with a malty background. Flavor follows. Surprisingly smooth mouthfeel. Great beer

Sample @ GABF 13. Pours a clear amber beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma is floral, citrussy, malty. Flavour is bitter, hoppy, long finish, lingering aftertaste. Watery texture, easy drinkable. Decent brew.

Canned. Deep amber beer with small beige head. Excellent ripped tropical fruit, passion fruit, hoppy aroma. Flavor very hoppy with mild sweetness, piney hops and medium body. Long bitter finish. Overall a very enjoyable American IPA (100813).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a copper/caramel color with some nice frothy white head leaving lacing down the glass.

The smell is amazing. Equal amounts of citrus and pine hops along with a little bit of caramel sweetness.

Taste is similar to smell. This beer is amazingly balanced. A little bit of sweetness, but the hops are very assertive and balanced nicely between citrus and pine. A little bit of malt sweetness asserts itself in the middle surrounded by wonderful hop presence. Really an all star beer.

Mouthfeel is a little thick without being too syrupy and good levels of carbonation. 

This is one fantastic beer. Ive been wanting to try one of these forever and finally got my hands on some and very satisfied!
Draft during RBSG. From notes. Citrus, pine and grapefruit with a decent bit of caramel. I like it.
Shared can to shakers. Floral hop aroma. Beautiful amber color. Beautifully balanced malt and hops.

Tap pour at Gold Nugget. Beautiful deep amber color and excellent lacing. Visually I may even go so far as to say stunning appearance. A citrus, hoppy affair that tastes better with each sip. One of the mainstream Surly options but still a good option.
Can. Hazy caramel color. Mild hops. Smooth and balanced. Bitter finish that isn't overpowering.
Brownish to amber in color with slight head. Smell of citrus and apricots mixef we ith cereal and grain. Very dry on the palate with slightly pine notes. Smooth mouth feel with minor bubbles.

Pour is hazy orange with white head and good lacing. Aroma of citrus, pine, caramel. Taste has some citrus, malt, piney notes, moderate sweetness, dry finish. Low-medium body and medium carbonation. A good ipa but was expecting a little bit more. Still very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Pours orange to amber with finger length head. Aroma of pine, biscuit malt, and herbs. Taste - wow. I can see why this is so highly regarded. Lots of tropical fruits, toasty malts, and a long-lasting bitterness that somehow still tastes smooth and balanced, like Ruination does - not overpowering at all. Great carbonation and mouthfeel. This is really darned tasty. Given the overall flavor profile, the closest comparison I can think of is Sierra Nevada Torpedo, but its better than that - the bitter herbal hops also have such a fruity characteristic. Like Ballast Point Sculpin, this would rank even higher for me in total points if the aroma were a bit stronger. Flavor and mouthfeel-wise, though, which is what matters most in a beer, this is the goods.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 On tap at Ikes at MSP. Copper with thin beige head. Plenty of lacing. Very aromatic - citrus, pine, caramel. Heavy sweetness followed by very bitter grapefruit hops. Slick, resiny mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Very nice IPA.
Tap. Copper. Great head and excellent lacing. Love the piney smell. Crisp, but very bitter. A great Minnesota standby.

Your first Furious is like a slap upside the head, and I say that in a good way. This is my favorite beer and I would rate it a perfect 100, but there is aways room for better. If you like hops, youll love Furious. If you dont love Furious, you dont like hops.

Amazing IPA. Great on the palate, so smoothed out yet strong with hops at the same time. Bitterness fads quickly but lingers slightly at the end. Lots of hop flavor rounded very nicely! Wish we could get this in CO!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
An extra from ygtbsm94. Thanks! Not nearly as Furious as I expected. Well balanced, delicious, medium pine hop bite in the finish.

Above average ipa with legendary status... Alot more balanced than expected( is that a bad thing?) aroma hits you of the hops then blend well with the malts... It's a fine beer worth a shot...

Burk från ölbutiken. Ganska dyr tycker jag men det beror väl delvis på om man är rik som ett as. 
Klen doft. Nötig! Kul, det var jag inte beredd på. Mandelnöt är tydligt. Kan inte utesluta att det kan bero på att jag åt popcorn för en liten stund sedan. Krämig och fin
Doften är tropisk frukt, gräs och inslag av malt. Smaken är besk men väldigt balanserad. Tropiska frukter, typ mango, maltig och relativt söt i avslutningen. God!
Copper pour, thin head, good lace. Nose is pine cones. Bitter. Middle is solid malt backbone with hints of apricot. Finish is deliciously bitter

Dark golden brown with floaties and a good sized white head. Smells of pine, citrus, grass but not much else. A good amount of bitter on the tongue that sticks around, some bread tastes, not really any sweetness but a tiny amount of toffee in the aftertaste. Overall didn't seem very well balanced, didn't care too much for it.

Im not an IPA/hop head guy. This beer is excellent. Smells like fresh squeezed pine and towering grapefruit. Wait. A beautiful sunset color. A bit more bitter than sweet. Finished slightly bitter for me. The quality put in is apparent, very well done!

16 oz can thanks to khoffman43. Pours a cloudy dark amber color with a thick foamy head that fades slowly and leaves nice lacing. Very nice fresh hop aroma. Big pine with some grapefruit, oranges, grass, and some biscuity malt too. Taste is a great mix of fresh pine mixed with creamy and biscuity malt. Taste has a nice slight sweetness with a moderate bitterness. Nothing overpowering here, just a great smooth IPA. I would drink this a lot it was distributed near me.

Aroma of big grapefruit zest, apricot and slight compost. Pours thick and red with a huge sticky ipa head. Taste is big and sticky with apricot, pine resin and caramel grapefruit. Very juicy mouthfeel. Great ipa. Thanks khoffman.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2013 Outstanding! My favorite Surly beer to date. Very hoppy, but well balanced. Drank fresh from Minneapolis.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. This is a clear wood-brown one with a medium sized light beige top. It has a fruity yeasty nose this. Some frozen strawberries, lots of melon zest. Its above average on the carbonation and its almost creamy in the mouth. Well hopped alright, did not smell like it should be all that bitter but it most definitely has tons of pine and pine cones bitterness A little bit tropical as well with pineapple and mango. Utterly a tasty one. 04.05.2013

Pours a cloudy amber with a fine white head. Nose is a malt bomb, frankly. It makes me worry. Flavor is malt, nuts, and grassy, with maybe a bit of citrus in there, too. The flavor profile is more interesting than the nose would suggest, but this drinks far more like an amber ale than an IPA to me. I dunno. I just cant get into this brewery.

Can - Earthy pine and caramel. Clear copper with a rich off white head. Very well balanced, so much so the high IBU are kept in check. The malts really stand out and the hops are just ever present. Finish is a bit dry with resin, but overall a great beer.

Tap. Pours a cloudy reddish copper brown with minimal off-white head. Aroma is heavy on piny hops, with some lingering malty sweetness. Flavor is all hops, with a bitter finish. Pretty good, but I personally would prefer a bit more malts and less bitterness in the flavor.

Can. Pours a beautiful reddish copper color. Nice big fluffy off white head with great lacing. Assertive piney hop & malt aromas. Taste is piney hops, grapefruit pith and just enough caramel malt to round it out. Full bodied with a dry bitter finish. Nice!
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Love the texture, wonderful palate, Minnesota company, beautiful appearance, great aroma I just cant handle the pine/insect repellent finish. I think it its going to be the most delicious thing I have ever tasted until I swallow not sure why I just cant stand the finish.

16oz can poured in snifter, canned on 6/20/13. A-mild citrus, pine grapefruit, not nearly as aggressive as I was expecting. A-Very red amber hue with an off-white head that quickly dissapears. T- just as I begin to taste some sweet carmel malts it quickly goes to grapefruit and pine bitterness. Good all around flavor. P- I do enjoy the carbonation and dryness to play with the sweetness to bitterness taste. Does a great job capturing the hop character. O- Very good beer. Hard to give it elite ratings though with all the recent IPAs Ive had comparably. I think to rank an IPA right now in the category is to state that the aroma and bitterness of the hop character or blend a brewer chooses to display should showcase the appropriate aggressiveness with the chosen malt. I love how the Furious looks, but the aroma and flavor left me wanting something more.

Aroma-average
Appearance-Beautiful Red hue
Taste-Good
Palate-Good
Overall-Very Pleasant beer but not in my top quartile.

Pours copper. Smells of orange, grapefruit, caramel and flowers. Taste is medium sweet, grapefruit, floral, orange, some caramel. Nice beer.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, piney and with a bitter finish.

Can courtesy of Casey, cheers mate! Consumed in a field at Truck Festival, Steventon, Oxon 19.07.13 watching The Family Rain (new band for me)   Pours hazy mud brown with off white head. Nose is hoppy but my factor 50 suntan spray is rather clouding matters a little. Can from Connecticut Avenue Liquor. Pours amber with a thin white head. Nice leafy piney notes on the nose. Nice hop flavor on the tongue without a ton of bitterness. Finishes clean. Nice!

Can at Mikkeller. Pours golden brown with a short white head and solid lacing. Huge acidic pine needle hop aroma, light orange peel zest with a balanced sweet malt backbone. Taste is big piney hops, resin and light caramel malt. Touch of orange peel zest. Fair whack of bitterness, nice body. Not as good as the abrasive!
UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 Beer had a light amber color to it. Aroma was strong & had a grapefruit aroma to it. Loved this beer. One of my favorites.

On tap at Ikes in Minneapolis Airport. A deep copper colour with a bit of whitish head. A real hop bomb, this one. A goodly amount of malt in there, though. Big hops and big malts in the same glass. Yes!

2013 can to a Dogfish Head IPA glass. Pours a copper/amber in color with a decent amount of off-white head. Lima thick coming out of the can, decent lacing. Aroma is hops forward with the malt sweetness following. Cat pee smell with some grassiness and some floral. Malt sweetness balances the smell nicely. Malt is not as prevalent in the taste. The hops take center stage with a floral bitterness following the slight slight malt taste in the beginning. Gives way to a grassy bitterness. Medium mouthfeel with a dry, astringent finish.

Bottle from Fratto. Dark and cloudy, light tan head. Smell of light hops, not very strong. Taste isn't strong hops, either. Not a bad IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2013 Tasted at Ward 6. A rich dark amber with a tanish head and even lacing. Pungent hop aroma and brilliant hop taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an autumnal copper color with plenty of particles in suspension, three full fingers of fluffy off white head and great lacing. Sweet caramel malt aroma balanced with grapefruit, citrus and tropical scents along with grassy and piney elements. Taste follows nose with big caramel sweetness that just barely tames the grassy and piney bitterness. Grapefruit and pineapple citrus flavors mid palate add to the big flavor profile. Finishes with a soft but pronounced bitterness that just invites you to take another sip. Mouthfeel is semi creamy and full bodied for an IPA with moderate carbonation. Wonderful IPA that has all the flavors I look for, with a bitterness that isnt too sharp. Every thing is in check with the malt supporting the hops allowing all elements to shine.

Light, crisp, with a complex and subtle blend of malt and hops. The hops come off a bit piney and resinous, but has a lot of subtle notes of tropical fruit, citrus, and candied orange. Very nice and refreshing though probably a little more piney forward than I would like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can into a pint glass.

A: Pours a cloudy dark copper color. The head is quite good; a one finger off-yellow shade thats very creamy looking. It retains acceptably, but not amazingly. Still, it does leave nice specks of lacing on the glass.

S: At first whiff, it seems like an IPA heavy in both caramel and pine (which arent always my bag), but this seems to have something else to set it apart from the pack. Maybe its the fact that grapefruit notes are fairly distinct here, or maybe its the fact that this has some nice fruit esters to them. All I know is that I really like the aroma.

T: The first thing I notice is a bit of caramel and toffee, right up until the hops take over. The hop profile is more piny/floral than grapefruity. I swear the finish is almost like grape jelly in a way. This is probably the calling card of this brew - the fruit esters, when they pop up, are fantastic. And after a while, I even note some peanut butter flavors on the back end...thats right, folks, this beer kind of tastes like a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. This is a solid, complex, yet unexceptional IPA otherwise; but damn. I cant tell if the PB&J flavors are an awesome feature or Im going insane.

M: A bit thick in body, with the carbonation giving it a bit more coarseness than I would like. Once that calms down, it becomes *very* soft for an IPA. Good drinkability, but it could also be drier.

O: Ill take any chance I can get to try this beer, so naturally I had to take a shot on a can that wasnt spectacularly fresh. At first, it struck me as just another IPA; after a while, its depth (and unusual yet pleasing notes) really start to impress me. If I ever see this again, Ill gladly give it a second chance.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 Amber pour, white head and white lacing. Citrus and hops in the nose and big time hops in the taste. Malty, hoppy and just a touch bitter. Really lovely.

16 oz. can compliments of ZMDR. Poured into a perfect pint glass and shows a deep amber hue. Lots if piney hops fill the nostrils, nice malty aroma in the background. As far as flavor: Im getting thick resiny hops (mostly pine with some faint citrus), sticky hop sweetness, bitter finish and hint of tea lingering at the very end. Nice and complex, not a one trick pony. Definately the second best American IPA that Ive had (from a 16 oz. can)!
Dåse: Næsten synd ovenpå abrasive, men stadig en super øl. Karamelfarvet klar med et fint skumhoved. Duften er mere ovre i gran og igen en smule citrus. Smagen er frisk og lækker.

From can. Pours brown/amber with little head and lots of lacing. Nose is early hops and some toffee. Aromas of earthy hops, some toffee, some breakfast tea. Tastes light/medium sweet and medium/heavy bitter. Medium body with lively carbonation. A beauty!

Can. Light hazelnut brown with a medium sized creamy off white head. Good retention and lacing. Bread, caramel, toffee, pine, floral. Pretty malt driven with some late bitterness. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Medium/full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. The bitterness is kept in place by a big hug from a soft, fat malt body.

A very hoppy IPA with a big, 99 IBU front---and do also a bitter bite at the back of the mouth. A really solid American IPA. That it comes in a craft can is an added bonus. Hope to see this move around the country. (Hint distributors.)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Mikkeller & Friends. Deep amber pour with lasting white head. Loads of thick pine resin and harsh grapefruit and orange in the aroma. Sweetish caramel too. Instant hardcore bitterness featuring pine, citrus, grapefruit and orange - hop oils coat the mouth completely. Some caramel and woody notes - fairly thick malt backbone. Medium mouthfeel. Lingering pine resin. Packed full of flavour - much more so than many of the high ABV 'hop monsters' I've had. Trip to Minneapolis anyone?

Smell of sweet Carmel.  Amber in color.  Taste is good but Abrasive is a lot better.  This is more resiny and piney.  Similar to abrasive minus the grapefruits.  Overall its good but just not nearly as good as a can of fresh Abrasive.

(can) amber with white head. Aroma is PINE with some hints of tropical fruits. Flavor is dominated by resiny pine but some tropical fruits and a solid malt backbone for balance (but not quite enough malt for my tastes).
Dark IPA. Very unique. Great complex palate. Almost like a stronge ale IPA combo. Very good.
On tap at Bulldog NE in Minneapolis. A nice amber color. Complex malty-herbal aromas. Flavor is stellar. Well balanced with just enough sweetness to cover the intense hop bouquet. Excellent!
Awesome brew. just about perfect.  great dark copper color, super clean, hoppy aroma, great balenced taste and silky smooth mouthfeel

Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet grassy, leafs, caramel malts, lawn, moss, hops, hay, pine needles, bark, minerals. Taste is slightly concentrated grassy, lawn, hops, leafs, bark, minerals, hay, pine needles, citrus peel. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught @ CBC 2013. Pours clear amber with a lasting frothy medium head. Aroma is tropical fruity with mango, pine, grapefruit, sweet caramel, elderflower and citrus. Taste is moderate sweet and moderate+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft+. Finishes bitter. Surprisingly drinkable, no where near harsh bitter.

Perfect hop/malt balance...check.  Creamy mouthfeel...check.  Expressive floral hops that linger on the tongue...check.  Smooth low alcohol sessionabilty...check.  Best standard ipa in the world....after many years of searching i think i am ready to say yes!

There is a reason why this is a hundo! It is quite simply delicious and duevto its deliciousness it is usually very fresh.  Lower abv for a 99 bitter but refreshing fruity and a great choice. One of my if not my favorite session IPAs ! Hard too find on the East coast.

Ce breuvage est axé sur les malts autant en arôme quen bouche. Le nez est spectaculaire, la bouche un peu moins mais la complexité du malt compense de façon magistral. Une belle résine habite le liquide, sapins, fleurs et une honnête amertume.

Translucent amber color with a dense, frothy head. Mild aroma of citrus, floral hops, biscuit malt, and hints of resin. Clean, crisp, and light-bodied. Little alcohol presence and a bitter finish.

Amber-mahogany hue. Light white head.  Toffee underscores a massive hoppy nose of fresh pine and citrus.  The mouth brims with hops, but I felt the Scottish malts didnt really match with the hops and like a dead backbone. It certainly provided an interesting body, but I though the body is much better suited to maltier brews.  I loved the nose and I loved the color and I loved the hops tickling the back of my throat and I loved the bitter finish, but the overall execution was just less exciting. Still unique beer that deserves credit, but not a 4.0 beer IMO.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Can from Chase, thanks! Pours amber with a couple fingers of head. Aroma is grass and pine goodness. Taste is very well balanced with a bitter finish, great brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Complex and rich flavor - bitter, floral, herbal, and a very smooth after taste. Perfect alcohol content for paced enjoyment.

Damn this beer smells good! Very piney with some citrus as well, pure hops. The taste follows suit, very dry, hoppy, just plain delicious. Mouthfeel is fairly resinous, crisp. Overall this beer was amazing. Extremely hoppy, not sweet at all refreshing, and also sessionable.

Surly is intoxicatiing, literally and figuratively. One has a hard time figuring out how they accomplish so much in this brew. The nose is fantastic the hops take over on first blush. You want to nose this IPA over and over but each long whiff makes you want to taste it more and more. All the aromas that will reach your nose become manifest upon tasting. What an amazing HOP BOMB. This is not for the faint of heart. Strong ruby red grapefruit spring to the forefront then the piney resins pop. Further still there is a swirl of sweet grasses and juicy stone fruits. Amazing! The hops attack the front of the tongue upon the first sip with sparkling bitterness. The wonderful red grapefruit then washes over the back of the tongue. The carbonation is aggressive but spot on as it delivers the full hop experience. There is little head retention and light lacing in the shaker glass I juat had .yet the carbonation still delivered as the beer warmed. Fresh on tap takes this fine sold canned IPA to an incredible level. The carmel malt holds this all together and provides the structure to this hop explosion. As the brew lingers on the tongue there are more and more flavors to be discovered, including tangerine and even a hint of musty barnyard. Surly Furious is challenging and complex and well worth the visit. Here in Mpls. it runs about $11.00 a 4 pack of 16 oz. cans.
Can, pours a bright golden, aroma is nice and hopppy and flavour too. It has a nice bitternice, the body is very light and it is yummy.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Nice citrusy aroma.  Great, strong citrus, citrus rind and a little pine resin hops flavor.  Perfectly balanced malt sweetness.  One of my favorite IPAs.  Quite heavy palate for an IPA, which really works for Furious.  Yum!

Pours clear copper with a small white head. Nose is grapefruit, pine, dank resin, caramel. The taste is sweet and slowly transitions to a big bitter. The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, heavy body and a long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First rate IPA...love that its tame on the alcohol.  Terrific floral, grapefruit, and dank, piney hop nose.  Bitter finish on a solid malt core.  Very drinkable.  A notch below Zombie Dust and Hopslam, but still delicious.
Copper color with white head.  Hoppy, citrus, malty aroma.  Nice hop bite, but balanced with malt, citrus, pine flavor.  One of my favorites.

Pours a clean copper with one finger of beige head that quickly recedes with webbed lacing.  Very piney aroma, some grapefruit and caramel. Sweet malts up front with a bitter hop and roasted malt finish.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Can at home.  Pours a deep copper.  Grapefruit and spruce absolutely explode from the glass. Taste starts bitter but quickly balanced by deliciously sweet malt - the intensity of the hops and malt is impressive. Pleasantly bitter finish. I might move to Minnesota.
Very good IPA. Nice citrusy grapefruit life flavor with a whole lot of bitterness. Yum

09/02/2013 Can 50cl (thanks Theydon_Bois!). Ambrata viva, lievemente torbida, schiuma bianca abbastanza abbondante e persistente. Al naso è agrumata, con sentori pinosi ed erbacei, il malto si sente bene. In bocca è molto amara, fortemente agrumata ed erbacea, malto anche qui molto presente. Corpo medio, carbonazione abbondante. Bevuta fresca, ma non freschissima, forse ha perso un po di spunto. Comunque è una ottima IPA.
Big hop nose. Sweet and Hoppy palate. Grapefruit and pine. Finish is mouthwatering and slightly bitter. Really good

A fine standard IPA - hops almost immediatley hit you in the nose, along with grapefruit and pine, which is balanced by a sweet maltiness in the taste. Finishes with a slight hop kick but isnt obnoxious about it.

Acquired via trade with Burgy.  I smelled the hops as soon as I cracked the can.  color is a copper orange with a nice white head.  Aroma of hops.  Lots of hops.  Possibly more than any other 6% IPA.  Mostly pine spruce.  touch of floral.  Great bitter taste, but doesnt kill the palate.  Really good stuff.  I mean damn.  Cant wait to try the abrasive.

Stunning IPA -- and I'm usually more partial to the Imperial variety. Is it bitter? Yes. But it's *balanced* by an incredibly rich malty flavor, which is hard to come by in a 100 IBU beer. I believe the deep amber color foreshadows this. I typically find beers have to be at 7.5+% to exhibit great flavor, yet Furious does it at 6%. Now I'm really looking forward to Abrasive, which is in the fridge ...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Also as a Minnesotan I really love this beer. The hoppier the better. I will be rating the Furious Abrasive next.

Seriously obsessed with this beer--especially as a Minnesotan. Makes ya proud. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap - good sized foamy head, medium amber color, nice big grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, fair malt backbone to go with it, very good beer overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At Big Beers, Belgians, & Barleywines Fest 2013.  Clear copper/amber like a marzen with a foamy white head.  Intense pungent hop aroma with floral wet hops, pine, and orange zest leafiness.  Flavor is excessively bitter with overt pine and grapefruit abrasiveness.  Malty sweetness seemingly nowhere to be found, except for a twang of earthiness toward the end.  Just too much for me.  But I can see why it gets love.

16oz can ---> snifter
Appearance - Copper, billowy head
Aroma - Pine, honey, tree sap, mowed grass
Taste - Fresh bitter hops, grapefruit, caramel

This brew here is nothing short of fantastic. The aroma is just as exciting as the taste; tons of fresh citrus (mainly grapefruit) among a caramel/honey sweet malt finish. Thank you Jordan - you sure do know how to pick em out!

I liked this one. Aroma was full of citrus, grapefruit, some pine, and a well water aroma. Awesome! Pours amber/redish with a nice head. This one had a watery mouthfeel but thats good for ipas in my opinion. Very refreshing. The taste is big bitter grapefruit and some pine trees. Caramel malts back this mother up. Great stuff.

Can. Pours mostly clear amber with average, creamy white head; decent retention and lacing. Aroma is grassy and floral hops, biscuit and cereal malt, lemon, and grapefruit. Flavor is hops forward (medium bitterness) with supporting bready malts, and citrus fruit esters; dry, lightly hoppy finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
16oz can->SA. Amber with thick offwhite head.  Aroma: STRONG hops, pine, citrus.  Big and bold.  Taste: huge hops and grapefruit.  The name is appropriate.

Can @ James - thanks. Dark red/dirty brown pour, plenty of head. Aroma is woody hops, palate is dry woody/piney hops, tight profile that comes and goes quickly and finishes a little bitter-dry. Clean and neat, fresh and woody.

Poured a can of it that was two weeks old for New Years Eve. Atrocious. Diacetyl and oxidation were the only recognizable characters in either aroma or flavor. Can was two weeks old, and was offensive to drink. Color was dark for the style. Poured nearly brown like Newcastle (which is appropriate, given the butterscotch flavor). Id like to try this out of their tap room. The can was a disaster.

2 week old can compliments of Jimbo with some friends, poured hazy brown amber with thin white head. Very sporadic lacing. Aromas and taste of heavy rye, booze, pine, grains, and light caramel malt. This one lacked tropicalness and was way too hot for 6percent. Maybe it falls off quick? No idea how this is rated so high but I am judging it on only one try so will try another batch when super fresh.

Pours a nice orange amber color in the glass.  Lots of bubbles streaming up from the bottom. Gives a nice 2 finger off white head with small tight bubbles.  The nose is huge hops immediately.  There is a grapefruit citrus along with an earthy herbal spicy note, hints of tropical fruits, mango.  Nice sweet smell.  The taste is the nose spot on.  Very nice, very balanced.  Leaves a nice lacing down the glass.  Great beer.

Can via my first shipment from France44. Pours a deep, ruby red body with thin white foamy head and minor lacing. Aroma is strong pine, so strong in fact that it almost becomes a bit boozy. Mouthfeel is surprisingly smooth, A nice fruity, caramel malt base layered nicely with pine and a touch of bitter grapefruit. My can is dated 2-3 weeks ago, so I would love to try this on draft or completely fresh. Would probably be a knockout.

Excellent ale that pours great out of a can. Good head and an excellent citrus/pine aroma. Great tasting ale, very hoppy but not overwhelming. I strongly recommend this beer. Currently available only in the state of Minneapolis

Can. Massive thanks to Crosamich for sourcing this! The pours a deep amber color with a medium off white head. The nose is summery fruit, strawberry shortcake, light sugar, caramel. Some spruce. The taste is fruit salad, pine cone. Earthy coniferous forest and watermelon. Caramel body. Lightly hoppy finish. Overall, smooth and tasty. Id imagine some bitterness has faded out of this, but it still drinks well indeed.

Poured from a 16 ounce can thanks to khoffman. Huge thanks! Pours a lighter copper with a white head of foam. The aroma is effervescent citrus and herbal notes. Taste is fairly bitter initially and throughout, but the beer sweetens on the tongue and then leaves a nicely balanced finish. This is a very good IPA.

Appearance is a dark golden/amber color with a nice 2 finger head with tight bubbles. Aroma was hit with nice piney notes followed by a hint of grapefruit. The taste followes the nose, however, the pine notes is diminished some while the middle of the palate has more grapefruit and citrus I thought I would have. Very much a fan with this having the perfect ratio of pine and citrus. Mouthfeel is light to medium, best described as crisp and refreshing.

16 oz. can. Shared with others, thanks to Zach. Pours a medium, poorly retained, off white head, with some lacing, over a slightly hazy, medium amber (SRM 12) body. Nose is heavy pine, resin, grapefruit peel, toffee/caramel......taste is pine, grapefruit peel, resin, toffee/caramel, hints of pineapple, finishing with a lingering bitterness.....mouth feel medium, slightly sticky, carbonation medium. This is nicely balanced, thoroughly typical American IPA. It is so typical as to be almost trite. BJCP 8/3/14/4/8
Shared from a 16 oz cane shared on Christmas Day. Pours clear amber with an of white head. Pineapple aroma. Luscious hop combination. Bitter finish. A really outstanding ipa.

Thanks to the dudes from Surly for hooking me up in this one.  16 oz can pours a dark amber with a white head.  Little darker than expected.  Huge pine and citrus nose, balanced perfectly.  Flavor is an even bigger rush of pine and citrus, with a nice malt balance backing it up.  The pine doesnt fade for a long time.  Crisp and delicious.  Superior.

Caramel color, low carbonation. Huge hop nose carries through to the palate; piney, citrusy. Very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 Reddish orange. Nice head. Hop is very balanced. Great hop flavor. Easy to drink. A tasty,  smooth, balanced beer.  Awesome stuff.
On tap. Beautiful amber color lacy head. Notes of citrus and hops.  Nice hop bitterness in front followed by sweet malt. Very good balance

Can shared with David at De Struise shop in Brugge (Thanks to Bill for the trade) - 01/12/12.
Lightly hazed amber with a thin tan head.
Nose is caramel malt, pine, hops, light citrus tones.
Taste follows, malty, piney, hops - extremely well balanced.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, fairly smooth, bitter finish.
A great IPA !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Dark amber in color with an off-white head, smell of....Holy HOPS!   This one is going to be a kick in the teeth, you can tell before even taking a sip.  Taste does not disappoint.  Glorious.  If you love hoppy beers you need to try this.

Can. Poured a deep amber with a two-finger off-white head. Classic IPA aroma with the hops and some citrus coming through. Taste was a little different than expected from the aroma, though. The malt comes through a lot more on the palate and its sweetness takes away some of the hop punch but in a great way because the hops still really come through, just with a different balance than a lot of other IPAs. Fantastic.

16 ounce can, canned on 11/21/12.  Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a dark amber color with about an inch off-white head that stays around for a long time.  Theres a decent amount of lacing.  Aroma is good, the brew smells like pine and citrusy (grapefruit) hops, along with some bready and caramel malt.  I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also the addition of some floral hops and a bit of tropical fruit.  Theres also a nice lingering hoppy finish.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its slick and smooth with moderate carbonation.  I have to say this is a pretty good brew, its rated high for a reason.  It wont take long for me to finish this 4-pack!

Wow, the hops explode from the can!  Excellent ipa that has the taste of a huge double.  Definitely will buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint can from De Bierkoning. Clear amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of pine and citrus hops, light malts. Flavour is pine and spruce galore and those are not my favourites of the hop flavours, nice crispy malts, hint of caramel, firm bitter hoppy finish. Light-bodied, soft mouthfeel. Good, but there are way better IPAs imho.

Can. The aroma is very floral, all hops. The taste has some bitterness up front. It is good, but not great. The bitterness last a little too long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Serving: 16 oz. can from khoffman43.  Thanks Kyle!  It pours a slightly hazy deep amber with a thick head of off white foam.  The citrus hop aromas pop out of the can as soon as you crack it open.  Great nose.  Lots of grapefruit and pineapple.  Bracingly dry and hoppy, truly a west coast IPA.  Light pineapple, peach, and grapefruit rind on the palate, with a nice malt backbone providing body and the slightest hint of sweetness.  Medium bodied with a lasting finish.  Outstanding IPA.
Can from bhensonb. Color is dark burnt orange. With off white head. Taste is malty and bitter. Smells like a barley wine to me. To malty
This is my go-to staple.  All other beers must pass the Furious Test to see if theyre worth buying again @ $2.50/pint.  I love the hops and grain remnants that float around the glass.

Can from Khoffman Thanks. Pours a deep copper color with a finger of sticky off white foam. Aromas are sweet malty goodness and fruity peach notes... on the palate it is a lot of the same with a big malt caramel backbone that balances nicely off the spicy peach notes that juicy up the middle to end of the beer. A nice bitterness comes in to finish it all off and lingers...
Can. Pours orange with full white head. Lots of fruity citrus on the nose. Taste is a great combo of sweet citrus and bitter floral hop
Pours a muddy orange with nice head and lacing. Aroma is pleasant pine and citrus. Very smooth. Hops really hit on the back end with lingering bitterness. Kind of reminds me of Pliney. Top notch.

Sample pour, yellow amber pour with full finger white head. Nose is full grapefruit with citrus throughout, bitter. Flavor is lighter, with lighter hop notes, citrus and faint smooth malt notes. Light lacing. Clean

This beer has a tremendous amount of things going on, busting up the ibu chart. Has great body and feel to it. Has a toffee, citrus, caramel taste to it. Blessed to have this available locally. One of my favorites
Beautiful red color and tons of hops with bitterness to match. A bit too hoppy for my taste, but a good beer.

Can (1 pint). Thanks Dresden! Clear ruby with a large fluffy but quickly fading off-white head and tons of lacing. Aroma of malt/caramel, pine and citrus. Taste of pine and citrus with a slight but discrete malty backbone. Heavy bitter/grapefruit finish. Mouthfeel is oily. Easily drinkable and enjoyable! It would have score a couple more points with a little more aromatic hops (maybe they have faded?).

Draft at maxwells in MN. Amber pour with a little white head. Crazy hoppy. Floral aroma and taste start to finish. Comparable to 2 hearted ale another favorite of mine, but hoppier.  Amazing beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 16 oz. can into a Deschutes snifter. Canned on 8/01/2011

A: Pours a dark ruby with golden hues around the edges due to the light. A one finger, off-white head form on the pour and subsides into a nice bubble film. Little splotchy sheets of lace around the glass.

S: Im pikcing up some piney hops on the nose with a little woody backnote. Quite interesting. Grassy and fruity notes on the end.

T: Bitter hops up front with an oaky/woody taste during the middle. The malt bill is also very present with some light cracker and gives it a slight grainy and grassy taste. The bitterness lingers throughout the taste and lasts even after the swallow. As the beer warms some of the citrus starts to pop gives the tongue a nice deviant course to follow.

M: Medium to light bodied with coating bitterness that lingers forever. Great carbonation that lasts and lasts.

O: A very malty and bitter IPA, it is very nice and really attacks the taste buds. Glad I have three more of these drink!

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 09-03-2011
Piney aroma.  Very hop forward, with caramel malt backbone.  One of my favorite year round IPAs.

Pours a dark orange/ red with a slowly dissipating latte froth head that leaves a nice lacing on my lager glass.  Aroma is resiny hops front and center, citrus hops and crystal malt.  Palate is slightly oily, but carbonated enough to keep it from being slick.  Deep pine hop notes, caramel malt, toasted notes, and more hops.  Solid, bready malt backbone to support and mitigate (some may see as a defect) the huge hop presence, but to my palate as balanced as a full-bore IPA gets. Slightly sweet and one of the easiest-drinking high IBU beers Ive had.  Finish is more lingering pine amd citrus.  Less of a hop assault than Ruination or Palate Wrecker.  Delicious and low enough abv to be sessionable.

16 can poured into a pint glass.

Appearance: Dark Golden Amber. Little darker for an IPA then Im used to. Finger of white fluffy head.

Aroma: Citrus fruits, pine, hops, caramel maltyness

Taste: Maltyness right up front. Followed by the hop presence. The citrus fruits really dominate the hop presence. Grapefruit,  tangerine, orange, and lemon peel. 

Overall: Super good! The malty flavors really mask the huge hoppy flavors. A little too much malt for an IPA for me, but Im not complaining at all. This made me not even notice it was around 100 IBUs. A very solid beer and well worth the 100 rating.

Poured a hazy copper color with a thin off-white head. Big fresh hop aroma with notes of grapefruit and pine. Caramel malt gives a backbone underneath. The flavor was hop forward. Hoppy grapefruit flesh and rind. Semi-dry finish. The bitterness at the end kept ramping up along the long finish.

Cannette offerte par Patrick. Bière orangée-caramel pâle avec une mousse solide. Le nez est de petit caramel qui précède une explosion de fruits frais, de pamplemousse et de fleurs de houblons. La bouche est mordante, le corps est moyen, les agrumes côtoient le caramel. Pas de défaut, peu de chose à redire, cette bière se laisse boire sans effort.
big bitter flavors, with citrus to balance.  great flavor from start to finish.  a little dry, but rounded.  great for bitter beer drinkers.

Une canette de 50 cl offerte par dresden.  Merci Steve!  Un liquide qui présente une robe ambrée sur laquelle flotte une petite tête mousseuse qui ne veut pas résister.  Au nez, des parfums dagrumes et daiguilles de pin qui combattent des malts caramélisés.  Sur les papilles, une véritable étendue houblonnée : de la verdure et des fleurs avec, en arrière-plan, des fruits exotiques.  Une présence très discrète des céréales maltées.  Donc, à mon plus grand plaisir, un sucré fantomatique.  En bouche, un corps plutôt moyen et des bulles vivantes.  Une texture à la limite huileuse.  Une finale intensément chargée par des notes amères qui transpirent le pamplemousse.  Je soupçonne une affaire débordante de fraîcheur.  Une IPA facile à boire, agréable et aucunement renversante.

This beer pours from the can with a deep reddish-amber color and is topped by a big, rocky, sticky head. The beer is very fragrant, with a big contribution from citrusy hops on top of a light, bready malt base. The flavor is big and bold, with juicy, resinous citrus and spicy pine over some noticeable but nondescript malty sweetness. The texture is mouth-filling without being heavy. Overall, this is just an all-around very good IPA.

Can - thanks Mike B! Pours clear amber with a large creamy tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is all hops - pine and grapefruit. Flavor is pine, grapefruit with a note of caramel in the background. Bitter and very mildly sweet throughout, finish is medium bitter and lasting. Yum.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2015 Update: Had this on tap again and it was superb.  Perfect amount of hop bitterness and fruity sweetness to counter.  Full flavored and easy drinking.  Color is great with excellent lacing.  Palate is smooth, medium bodied, perfect for the style and taste.  Versatile IPA that is a "go-to" and will never disappoint. 

Pours a hazy amber with great head retention and very nice lacing.  Aroma is pine and some orange and sour citrus, with just enough caramel malt making a showing - really good.   Taste is very hoppy and there is tons of flavor for the ABV.  Aftertaste is grapefruit bitterness, but not too much.  This is a great beer.  10+5+8+4+16=4.3  (2/5/13)
Grapefruit aroma and flavor up front - bitter and hoppy going down.  Everyone I know seems to love this beer, and now I can see why.  7+5+8+4+17=4.1

500mL can, pours a cloudy orangey amber with a medium beige head. Aroma of resinous and slightly spicy hops, and some butterscotch malts. Flavour of resinous hops, slight candied sugar, and slightly smoked malt to back. The smoked malt character shines through quite prominently, with a high astringency on the finish. Seems overrated to me - though solid IPA.

Can from a trade. Pours a surprising ruby/amber. Slightly sweet, light bubblegum aroma. Taste is hop forward with an assertive bitterness but a perfect, light malt balance that even imparts a slight bit of vanilla. Super drinkable. Doesnt seem like a 100 IBU bite.
Middle of the road.  Really hoppy but the flavor is over bearing.  Amber color makes it appealint.
Pours a dark amber with nut and hop aroma, Malty and hop flavors up front with a slight sweet finish.

Copper colored with a tan head head. Strong aroma of hops, both resinous pine and tropical fruit. The flavor is much as expected from aroma, a bit sweet but mostly bitter. Lighter body, with small bubbles. A good bitter beer.

Pint into Duvel tulip.  Amber with massive off-white head.  Aroma is floral and tropical, pretty solid.  More malty than your typical IPA.  Decent tropical flavors, somewhat piney bitter, pretty good and drinkable overall but doesnt belong in the same category as Pliny and Heady.

440 ml can courtesy of GT2. Thanks man! Pours tiny hazy deep amber with a creamy and frothy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky lacing on the glass. Smell is slightly sweet, very hoppy fresh and fruity with sweet bread, pine, overripe orange peal, grapefruit zest, resin, freshly cut grass, overripe green grapes, pineapple, overripe mango, cape gooseberries, peaches and hints of wet moss, moist wood and grapefruit juice. Taste is sweet, very bitter, fruity and herbal with bread, caramel, pine, grapefruit juice, grapefruit peal, orange peal, dry soil, fresh grass, unripe mango, unripe pineapple, lemon balm, dill, wet moss and grape zest. Mouthfeel is slightly round, slitly oily bitter, dry and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with dark bread, unripe pineapple, unripe mango, pine, resinous wood, moist soil and citrus peal.

Canned at Mumsig Miniprovning, Göteborg. Deep golden beer with a big offwhite/beige head. Pineapple aroma, grapes, pine needles, mango, pears, perfume, biscuits, grassy bitter hops, milky notes. Bitter hop flavor, grass, caramel, earthy notes, dry, pine needles, woody, mango, grapes, citrus, some milk, some pepper. Great body and wonderful flavors. Bitter fruity finish, grassy, hay, grapes and grapefruit. Wonderful beer!

Can @ MMP. Pours clear deep amber with a good bubbly beige head leaving laces. Aroma is fruity grassy malty resiny some tropical fruits and a bit soapy. Flavor is dry fruity malty caramel grassy all well in balance. Finishes longlived fruity bitter malty.
pours red with a thin white head.  aroma is floral with note of grapefruit and caramel.  taste is much the same with a very wet body.  finish is hoppy but full of flavor.  a great beer.

on tap various times
Good IPA with solid coloring and strong hoppy flavor. Very consistent with great aroma. Nice butterscotch color. Overall a very good IPA

I had this when it was first released and had a syrupy batch, but since then it is very good.  Tasted fresh at the brewery last night and it is quite good.  Great American bittering and aroma hops with a moderate malt and caramel body.  I love the choice of English yeast for American style beers and this beer is a great example of how it works well.  Nice off white head that dissipated quickly, but no lack of body.  Good choice when in the mood for hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Thanks to bnielsen13. Pours a orange color with a orange hued head. Piney, hoppy, grassy, and caramel malt aromas. Very forward hoppy flavor, but the malt balances it out, so that it isnt just a hop bomb.  Very tasty, very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 (sample courtesy of Mark, thanks! April 2013) Pours a clear amber with little, tan head that dissipates. Aroma is peach and passion fruit hoppy goodness. Oily texture, medium carbonation, full bodied with a strong malt backbone finish. Flavour is fruity hops initially and then the malty sweetness kicks in taking away the bitterness.
Original rating July 18th 2012: (1 pt can courtesy of steasy66, thanks! Canned on June 28th 2012) Pours a mostly clear, dark amber with creamy, medium head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is wonderfully hoppy on the side of tropical fruits with notes of what resembles peach and passion fruit. The pine in there is hard to detect at least for me. Oily texture, medium body, medium carbonation and a long, moderately bitter finish. The malt kicks in early on taking a bit of the hop character out of the flavour leaving a dry, lingering bitterness towards the end. I would say I have tasted a more pleasant hop profile in the Punk IPA and the Havgus for example but on the aroma this one is extremely appealing and altogether very drinkable. Girlfriend says: "Its very bitter for me, but the aftertaste gets slightly sweet."
Taster @ deans. Aroma is huge resinous and cheesy hops, sublte bready malt note. Flavour is big bitterness, piney and fruity. Thinner body then expected.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Almost clear, brown body with frothy head. Fragment hop aroma, pine and some light yeast. Quite clean feel to this. Solid taste, fair amount of bitterness. Bit too clean maybe. Fine. (At Deans Tasting) 

Tasted again courtesy of Simon of La Cave à Bulles. Very clean indeed, like my first rating. With that distinctively American and great for that too! Huge hoppy aroma and matching bitterness. Great (double) IPA.

Can shared at tasting.  Pours clear amber with a small off white head.  Aroma of pine, resin, malt, grass.  Flavour is heavy bitter and llight to moderate sweet with a big bitter finish.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

50cl can shared with friends.
Thin white head.  Lovely citrus aroma.  Clear amber pour.  Lovely bitterness.  Yummy brew!

Can brought back from MSP. Incredible piney aromas blended with thick malt, like brewpub sawdust. Deep orange-brown color. Rich malt with a great hop balance. Medium-heavy body. The malt and hops battle it out, and end in a draw.

16 oz. can. Poured deep ruby with the light khaki head that left the thickest sheets of lace possible. Floral, piney nose. Flavor is a near perfect balance of malt and resinous pine and citrus fruits.  Dry, bitter finish but not tongue stripping. Not my style of IPA but this shit is amazing.

Wow what a great hoppy beer! Aroma was big and full of hops. Strong bitter grapefruit rind and pine with a hint of earth. Pour was a nice foggy dark gold with a one finger off white head. Taste was intense and bitter.There was a burnt malt backbone going down the middle with a heavy hop flavor surrounding it. Strong and bitter with the grapefruit rind and pine bordering household chemical flavor (which isnt a bad thing for me). Nice carbonation. The finish is extremely hoppy and bitter. Great beer!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Interesting head, sticks strong to sides of glass. Strong IBU kick, but then there is a quick yield to overwhelming bitterness.

TEA BAGGED FURIOUS poured from a cask at dark lord day 2010. this was beyond murky. TONS of sediment floating around. light orange in color. no head. huge floral and citrus hops just crushed the nose. some was spilled from the first keg and the hops lingered around the tent, it ruled. but huge floral hops mainly dominated. this was all hops, there were no malts. the floral hops dominated with a very flower like flavor. huge citrus followed but a sweet citrus and very faint bitterness. i even found part of a hop leaf in my cup. amazing.
very full body, kind of chewy but went down very smooth. this was the highlight of my day. i could not stop drinking this and everyone that had a sip, loved it. it speaks for itself. Serving type: cask. Reviewed on: 04-25-2010

Location/Date:Can on June 23rd, 2012 shared with Dave and Travis.
Appearance: Pours a dark copper. 
Aroma: Aroma is of caramel, citrus.
Taste: Medium bitterness, nice amount of sweetness.
Palate:Medium body.
Summary: Why oh why does Surly only sell in Minnesota?!? Well at least I got to try 4 of their beers in June 2012...PS - thanks Travis for sharing, and EB for acquiring the beers.
Pours a pretty amberish color. Smell is alive with citrus and hops. Taste is good, hops, citrus, some malts. Feels medium bodied and bitter in the mouth and overall is a high quality beer.

Nice Orange gold with slightly off white head.  Some chunks in this guy. Impactful malt that stays light but almost makes you think imperial. Thorough citrus driven hop with some grapefruit. A real treat.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 My favorite of the Surly year-round selections! Aromatics are hop heavy with citrus notes. Pours out of a can deep orange with a decent size head that does dissipate. Taste is not overly bitter even for 100 IBU?s. I love the whiskey notes that the malt gives the beer (probably why I like it soooo much!). Palate is medium bodied, which gives great mouth feel without over doing it. Love this beer!
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Drank from the can, has a beautiful pine and citrus aroma. The taste is very smooth. The malt background is impressive with citrus hop flavor. Perfectly balanced and delicious.

Can pours golden ruby with off white head and lots of hop and yeast floaties. Smells amazing with a sweet smooth citrus and pine. The taste us much the same but more amazing. Piney grapefruit and tangerine with a hearty toasted grain make it rich and moderately robust but it finishes crisp and smooth, not to dry. This is one of surlys best.

[Thanks to MatSciGuy]. 1 pint can. Orangish colour with a good formation of an off-white, creamy, dense, nice lacing and perfect lasting head. Aroma is hoppy, fresh with notes of resins. Flavour has notes of pine, resins, fruits, and slightly caramelish. Smooth on palate and a final with a decent bitterness. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is slightly oily.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2012 Theres a slight hop aroma. This brew isnt fully filtered. You will see the ingredients floating around. Thats something I enjoy seeing. The furious has some wonderful flavors that go together very well. It is a very balanced beverage. Afterwards your palate will survive the experience unharmed but your mouth will desire more.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2012 Pours an amber with an off white head.  Huge aroma.  Strong in pine, grapefruit, orange, and pineapple, with a few malty undertones.  Taste is very similar, but somehow this is even more powerful.  More pine and grapefruit over the other impressions while being a bit peppery as well.  But through all of this, the hops are overwhelming.  Any hops lover will really appreciate this.  This one is more medium bodied and is fairly easy to drink.  Overall, this has all of the taste, aromas, and impressions of a hard hitting beer, yet is a bit on the lighter side in reality.  Fantastic effort on this one.  I couldnt be happier with this.

No idea when this was canned, looks like the date stamper was down on this particular day. 16 oz tall boy into a tulip glass. As soon as I cracked the top I could smell tropical fruits!

A - Dark amber body thats almost bordering on red. Massive light khaki head forms and dies down to some spotty lacing and thick edging. Tons of coating on the wall as the beer goes down. Looks damn near perfect.

S - Layer after layer of papaya, mango, peach, and grapefruit. Super tropical with a touch of pine and biscuity malt on the finish. Im also getting a bit of dank resinous hops.

T - Considering the 6.2% abv and 99 IBUs, its actually rather tame and drinkable. Papaya and mango with a nice english biscuit finish. Light notes of pine and some herbal dankness intertwine with the fruit. Biter finish. Not as impressive as the aroma.

M - Medium bodied and coating but fairly light in carbonation. 

O - Not a perfect AIPA, but one that I wish I had access to. Lots of nice tropical hop notes that go along with some faint herbal and piney ones. Surly knows how to make some awesome hoppy beers.

Poured into my ccb pint glass, reddish brown, half a finger head, hazy. Aroma of hops with malt in background. Taste follows the nose hops with little malt, no balance. Citrus from the hops is good just not great. Highly carbonated. Its good just not great, after having abrasive(excellent) its hard to tell they are both from the same brewery.

16 oz can, hazy copper amber with small off white head. Didnt take notes in the MSP airport but this IPA is a quality brew. Very nice, creamy, rich malt flavor without being too sweet. Plenty of hop flavor and bitterness to balance it out. 
I think this fresh from a newly tapped keg would be well into the 4s rating.

Can-no date on bottom (how old is this thing?).  Hmmm, well i have to start this review by saying that for what it is, this is a decent beer.  however, i dont think i got the most fresh sample.  How old is this can?  No date on the bottom.  Pours dark orange with a soapy off-white head.  nose is of sweet hops, carmel malts and some metalic notes (earth).  Doesnt come across to me being that punchy.  flavors exhibhit the earthy hop flavors with some lite pine.  99ibus?  Where?  Seems more brittish than i was expecting.  WIth that said, the beer is well crafted and very clean.  I must find this beer more fresh.  If this IS a fresh sample, than im very dissapointed with this beer.

Originally reviewed: 4/14/09. Poured into my pint glass. Pours a very deep dark amber with a huge off-white frothy head on top. Its 10 minutes later and theres still about a quarter inch resting on top. Decent sticky splattering on the glass edge. Huge scent profile of piney and citrusy hops. Very floral and sweet smelling. Very inviting this one is. 

Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Carbonation level is spot on. Flavor is bitter right of the bat with a huge hop profile. As I go along though this gives way to a sweet malty presence full of caramel flavor. Drinkability is extremely high on this one. Probably the best representation of an IPA Ive had to date.

Can. Pours a dark copper orange color with a beige head. Aroma is of grapefruit, orange, sweet pine, resin and caramel. The flavor follows the nose lost of sweet pine, resin, grapefruit, orange, herbal notes, toffee, caramel and a touch of peach. The body is medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall a pretty tasty IPA.

The definition of 'hops' I'm told. This beer was fantastic. Served in a glass, this beer's aroma and taste are both quite good and memorable. I now understand why people speak so well of Surly brews. Definitely give it a try if you have the chance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a murky burnt Orange color with a nice dense off-white head. Outstanding head retention, which leads to good lacing. Sweet citrus aromas with a hint of spruce. Hops control the palate with bitter citrus flavors with some evergreen tones. The sweet malts balance out the bitterness perfectly. Mild carbonation with a smooth and clean backbone. Very complex palate for an IPA. Nice and crisp with a dry finish. Very nice drinking IPA. Surly Is making amazing beer....and in cans no less!

pours a very dark copper, with a fast dissipating head. Fruity, floral, piney and grassy hop aroma. Hop sediment In the beer which I love. Interesting malt character to this beer. Big time Backend hops with some pineyness. Good, but not great.

Hop explosion. Awesome deep copper color. Intense hop aroma. Solid malt profile to hold everything together extremely well. Grapefruit and citrus hop flavor at the beginning, malt in the middle and finishes with an amazing bitterness that left me wanting more. Great brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A fantastically bitter, grapefruity beer explosion. In your mouth. Not really an IPA but instead some kind of crazy beer challenge. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear copper of color with an off white head. An aroma of citrus, pine, hops, malt, tea and grapefruit . A flavor of hops, citrus, tea, dusty, malt, pine and grapefruit. Very nice!

Pours a dark amber color. Nose is citusy and piney hops with some bready malts under it all. Taste is much like the nose with the citrus and pine from start to finish with a nice bitter hop finish. Medium bodied.

Pours a medium dark amber with a small white head.  The aroma is very hoppy with notes of citrus, resin, pine, grapefruit, and apricot.  The taste is more hops, citrus, and pine with a well pronounced almost toasty malt backbone.  Firm bitterness and dry throughout.  Just an all around outstanding beer.

16 oz can from De Bierkoning (at  3,- very reasonably priced!). Pours a clear copper red color. Tan, sticky head, long retention. Aromas: resin, citrus, bitter (acidic), some dried fruit & caramel malt. Flavor is bitter with some (caramel) malty sweet notes. Medium bodied. Finishes herbal bitter. India Red Ale?

Deep amber pour with a nice big head that sticks around. Aroma is very hoppy. Some sweet notes in there.  Big creamy mouth. Taste is pretty bitter. Nice juicy hop finish. Overall a nicely crafted pale.

Can:
Medium to bigger vast creamy off white light light tan head, disappears slow, on top of a dark ruby colored beer.
Smell lots of exotic fruit, citrus, peach, pine, light raisin,  hops, some sweet barleys.
Taste fruit, exotic fruit, peach, abricot, citrus, pine, grape, hops, bitter, some light sticky barley malts, light yeast notes, hint of herbs and some fresh grain notes.
Very well balanced and a a very nice subtle transmission from loads of hoppy fruit to some more hoppy bitterness.
Nice medium bitter hoppy light fruity herby aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft tingly mouthfeel, medium to full body and a creamy texture.
Lots of fresh hop fruits, a nice bitterness, well balanced, a delicious beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2012 Thanks Mark!

1 Pint of beer in a can. Bottom of the can reveals that this was canned on 02/14/12. I tip my hat to Surly for supplying us with freshness indicator.

Pours a reddish-brown color (quite dark for an Ipa). The cream colored head stood an impressive two fingers tall following the pour. When you hold it to the light, its a beautiful red color. Plenty of lacing on the glass.

The aroma has hints of pine, grapefruit, and caramel malts, but its on the mellow side for the style.

Taste features a nice balance of hops and malt up front. Theres definitely some earthy flavors that follow, which I almost expected after I saw how dark this was. I hate to say it (and I know that some will disagree), but Im getting a sort of metallic taste that Ive experience while drinking other canned beers. The hop bitterness lingers a bit on the back end making for a nice finish.

Medium bodied mouthfeel with moderate....approaching high carbonation.

A nice Ipa, but for me, it didnt live up to the hype overall.

Moreys Bottom Line: Ive been waiting to try this for quite some time, and Im a bit disappointed. Its still a good beer, and I would definitely drink it again, but I wouldnt go out of my way.  Im generally a bigger fan of citrus forward IPAs. This is more in the vein of Titan or Ballast Point Big Eye.
Thanks to Cpt. Cleveland for the pour. Very dirty and gritty. First sip is a grapefruit bomb, but balances out nicely and extremely wet. Pretty dang good.
Can courtesy of MBrausen. Pours a dark orange with a white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, and hops. Taste bitterness from the hops, caramel,  citrus, and pine.  Best IPA Ive ever had from a can.
Poured from can, looks the part. Nice aroma, nice taste, nice overall. I like this.
CAN and TAP: Aroma is pine, earth and citrus. That taste matches the agressive aroma and is very bitter and not a lot of malt  but what is there is caramel.

Dark copper pour with a thick off white head and a ton of lacing. Nice aroma of citrus and pine. First drink shows the bitterness with lots of pine and citrus. Wow, this is a very drinkable,and  well balanced IPA. Small bit of breadiness to off-set the hops.

Can; Pour is murky golden amber with a fine bubbled khaki head that retains well ; spotty lacing as well. The nose is pine resins, grass, caramel. The flavor profile is more resinous piney hops - its nice. Some tropical fruits peek through, but the malt profile, however, seems to fade through the finish and the beer feels less complex than I was expecting. I think I was generally a little disappointed overall based on the status of this brew.

I am told that the can I tried had some age on it so i will have to try to get ahold of a fresh can sometime. +++ Sampled from a 16 oz can this beer poured a caramel-amber color with a huge fluffy off white head that left good lacing. The aroma was caramel, pine and grapefruit. The flavor was sweet caramel, pine, grapefruit and faint floral and perfumey hops. The finish was long and dryish floral and fruity hops. Medium body.
Best beer Ive ever had hands down.  Ill change my rating if I ever drink a better beer.  But until I do, this one cant be beat in any category.

From notes.  First reviewed 11/24/2010.  Poured from a 16 oz. can into a pint glass.

Furious pours a full amber cherry color, slightly hazy with a huge fluffy off-white sea foam head. Nice retention, and lace sticks all over the glass on the way down.

Boom! Tons of caramel malt, grapefruit, and piney hops... just when I crack the can open. When I get down in it, the hops have some herbal character, but the pine is still the most dominant. 

Furious just knocks my socks off - this is what I want an IPA to be. Sweet buttery toffee and caramel up front. Spicey pine provides an intro to the hop profile. Juicy grapefruit and pineapple, then more pine. Some sweetness comes back at the end to finish relatively clean. 

Great huge hops create a tingling sensation on the tongue. The right level of carbonation gives it a creamy feel, almost buttery. The hops make it juicy. The only thing that really detracts from the feel is that a little hop oil remains on the tongue and some stickiness stays on the lips after each sip.

Give me this all the time. Could Abrasive be better than this?  Update: No, Abrasive is not better.  Furious is just about perfect.

Amber color, nice carbonation, nice two-finger creamy tannish head, lots of small islands and sticky lacing follows. The nose is malty, hoppy, piney, nice touch of grapefruit, and some caramel. The taste is hoppy, piney, grapefruity, and nice touch of caramel, a slightly dry finish. Medium body. Very drinkable

Poured into a Duvel tulip from a can canned on 12-13-11.

A: Very nice looking beer with a murky garnet body and a dense tan rocky head. Head leaves a huge mess on the sides as it slowly shrinks.

S: Slight tropical fruits with a piney bitterness. Mellow, but smells good.

T: Wow! This is really well balanced. The flavors hit at once and go through to the finish. The strong malt base balances out the piney bitterness making this very drinkable despite the high IBUs. 

M: Medium bodied with lively carbonation.

O: Hats off to Surly for making a great first impression to me. This is a beer worth drinking often!
Furious has a very citrusy aroma complimented by a beautiful pale orange appearance. Taste is hoppy and fruity. The crisp mouth feel makes this an easy drinking beer.

Dark, muddy orange in color.  Fluffy white, two finger head.   Mango and peach with a touch of pine on the nose.

Grapefruit.  Very bitter but well balanced by the malt.  Hard to believe this is only a 6.2% beer!  Super drinkable.  

What an awesome brew.  As far as IPAs go, it doesnt get any better than this.

fresh can via trade with samtallica on BA , bottled on 1/11/12

pours a lovely pale hue into my cheater pint capped by a small unwaivering off white head, Nose is full of pine, pineapple, and grapefruit, slight hint of alcohol. Cutting bitterness and citrus upfront are slightly washed away slick maltiness. Faint hint of caramel. Taste feels like a bit of a let down when campared with the aroma. medium bodied, this is a solid IPA.

Poured from a pint sized can. Citrus/pine hops dominate this beer. This was a hop attack on my palate. I enjoyed this beer very much. The hops never got grassy or vegetal, hard to do with a beer that is this hoppy.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2012 
This beer makes an appearance in my fridge at least once a week. I chose to review a can that has about four weeks on it because thats realistically about the average batch youll find at most metro liquor stores on any given day.

Poured from 16oz can to Surly pint:

Pours a still, hazy amber gold with a swelling frothy head - off-white, pushing a very light brown. Precise lacing.

Smell and taste:

There is an obvious malt backbone of caramel and dark syrup that supports a splendid hop profile. Pine tree notes are most obvious but there is a clear citrus presence as well. The beer finishes with a dry orange peel bitterness. Youll find a more dominant hop bite from a super fresh can but this one certainly does the job.

What a perfect flagship beer this is.

Acquired in a trade and very excited to try this. Poured into a Newcastle glass right out of the fridge.

A - Poured a light tan head of about 1.5 fingers. The beer itself is a deep amber / wood color.

S - Tons of pine from the amazing hops used in this beer. I get roasted notes and some salty bits as well. Lots of sweet going on here.

T - Beyond the hops, Im getting grape juice and apple juice. Theres some sweetness here as well. Also some spices but I cant pinpoint. Maybe cinnamon? 

M - Lots of carbonation but the beer still retains the liquid properties even after heavy swishing. 

O - Delicious. I love canned beers and a canned IPA in pint size just makes my day. Excellent!

Pours dark amber for an IPA for an IPA with tons of sediment - I am assuming hop resinsl The aroma bring pleasant notes of sweet and bitter hops lighter but pleasing and noticeable on the palate, not aggressive or abrasive like the Abrasive because of a malty base. The flavor of malts is a basis begins with light bitter hop notes that bring zesty citrus notes to the palate. The settle slowly on the palate with lemon zesty notes.

Poured an amber red hue with moderate head that left lacing as it slowly faded. Smells like I opened a vacuum sealed bag of hops; mostly citrus with a bit of pine. As much as the malt is touted in the description, the star of the show is bitter citrusy hops (obviously). It is very light on the palate for the IBU.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 17 Apr 2013, can. rosey amber, clear, occasional bubbles. aroma is gorgeous peaches and grapefruit. thin body and moderately fizzy. gorgeous on the nose, mediocre on the tongue. piney hops and copper malt. only okay.
27 jan 2012, can. Rosey amber, clear, no bubbles. Aroma is a grassy hopped Scottish ale (American style). Med body and a bit fizzy. Decent ale. Moderately hopped for a Scottish ale, but. It excessive. Nice and malty w enough hops to make it fun. Not a Scottish ale though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can to snifter. Dark amber/brown color with a big fluffy head. For this style there is a good amount of hop presence. Not too malty but has a very solid balance of earthy characters.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Copper with tall white head. Aroma dominated by piney hops. Taste is again dominated by piney hops but also some grapefruit. Strong malt backbone balances this well. Although the hops are forefront, the bitterness fades to a bisquity, toasty malt. Rather creamy. Easy drinking and even though itÃ¢â¬â¢s over 6% ABV and has a rather full body, it has a nice refreshing character. Easily one of the best beers IÃ¢â¬â¢ve had.

Pours dark amber with average head that persisted. Toasted malts with heavy pine and grapefruit hops.  Light bodied with average carbonation.  Moderate acidity with heavy bitterness that lingered throughout the long finish. Delicious!
Can. Pours amber with quarter inch white head. Aroma is fresh grapefruit. Flavor is caramel and grapefruit. Very nice IPA (though it should probably be classified as an imperial amber ale).

My standard and also my "go to" for IPAs.  On tap at Zorbaz, Detroit Lakes, MN.  Very complex citrus flavors with an aroma to match.  Clean finish for such a powerful taste.  Much better than two hearted IMHO.   Never let me down, except for distribution.  Bring it to Detroit Lakes Muni so I can have it in my bar on tap Surly!!

Amber Orange with a slight haziness.  Thin off white head.  Tastes a bit dry like a rye red, and has a huge hop presence.  Every sip get smoother and makes my smile wider. Oops! *Sushi burb* better have another drink.

Aromas of citrus, resin, pine.  Hazy deep copper,  off-white head with decent lacing.  Taste is sweet with big malty body, and wonderful bitterness that is not overbearing.  Very nice balance for the style and the finish dry and bitter.  Overall, this is a wonderful beer with the great citrus flavors blended with the caramel and golden malts.  Just mmmm.

(16oz can from Alpar).  Pours a hazy copper color with a frothy off-white head that leaves some nice lacing.  Aroma has resin, some tropical fruit and unripened mango.  Taste is sweet mango with bitterness.  Light bodied with an oily texture. Nice stuff.
Pours a reddish orange with little.  A little past its prime, but still has defensible qualities indicative  a solid ipa.

I have driven from Chicago to Minnesota just to get this beer for me and my nieghbors. I make a clone kit from northern brewer and it is always the frist keg empty.  Even people who dont like IPAs love this beer.
Overly hoppy with a robust grapefruit punch.  Fine if you like that short of thing, but I think it lacks balance.
Can. Dark amber pour with decent tan head. Herbal and earthy aromas. Citrus  and some grassy and floral  with mild oxidation flavor tones.

Can, big thanks to Tripplebrew. Poured into a shaker. Great eye appeal with solid retention. You get every hop aroma possible. (Pine, grapefruit and a tad floral) Lots of fruit in the taste and a balanced malt to support it.  Anything else I say would be a repeat of other ratings BUT I will say if you are a Hop Head, you need to get a few cans of this. Or take a road trip and get a case or two. This is an amazing IPA, no matter how you spin this or how much you want to dissect it, no flaws at all. I am kind of sensitive when it comes to bitterness and I still find this fantastic!

16 oz Red Can. Shared tasteing with Chris the owner of The Bridge View Tavern. Forget everything that you heard about canned craft beer. This brew dispels all the negative rumers. Crisp refreshing very hoppy and dry. A little grass but very flavorful all the way through! Enjoy

Pour dark copper with a whitish head good lace. Aroma pine, citrus, resiny hops, caramel, hints of roasty malt, earthy, caramel, tropical fruit, berries?. Taste tonnes of resinous hops, with a sinister amount of caramel, and toffee to back it up, citrus, grapefruit and pine are all there to consume the palate, also some earthiness to help round out the brew. MF medium chewy body with nice carb.  Wow what can I say but thank you Dresden this is definitely one of the best IPAs I have had with terrific balance, great taste and a healthy amount of hops, this is a crusher.

Pours a nice copper color with a redish hue to it. It smells of floral and pine hops with a little caramel note. LOVE IT! The taste is of big citrus and pine with a nice malty backbone. BITTER! A great beer!!

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2012 On tap at blue nile pour is a fiery amber and taste is just suberb big floral nose that carries through the taste clean finish great start to my tour de surly

Tea Bagged Furious: On tap at Busters 4Oct2012, woody sweetness up front followed by the excellent furious hop flavor rules.
